She enjoys being at home with her three children. Rose N. is planning to reinvest her profits in her business and save for her future plans and challenges.

loans.use: To purchase maize, cooking oil and cassava dough, in bulk and sell to customers.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael grows corn and beans and works on a nearby farm. He works hard because it has a very nice family and wants the best for them.

 Rafael needs a solar home system because their youngest child attends school, has homework, and needs better lighting. He will be happy to see his child do homework without the risk of fire or poisoning from kerosene gases. The rest of the family will have sufficient  electricity in the home.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system.

loans.name: Meharun

texts.en:
Meharun is 23 years old and lives with her husband and one infant daughter in Alipurduar, West Bengal.  Meharun studied till 12th grade. Meharun's husband is a car driver by profession. His inconsistent income is barely adequate to meet all household expenses. In order to provide financial sustenance to her family, Meharun started her own micro-enterprise selling tableware.  

Meharun has been running a business selling tableware and crockery like cups, plates, bowls, etc., from her house with the help of her husband. She supplies these items to the retailers of the same town and other villages. She purchases bulk stock from the nearest wholesale market. Due to the better quality of her product and her timely delivery, the demand for her goods is on the rise. But to meet the orders of her customers, she needs some capital. 

Meharun desires to expand her business by taking a loan from Kiva's partner, BJS. From the present loan, Meharun intends to purchase a good deal of tableware and crockery. This will help her to catch the attention of more clients. 

Meharun hopes this loan will give a boost to her business and with the business profit she can provide a better education to her only daughter.

loans.use: To purchase tableware and crockery for reselling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a gallbladder surgery to improve her state of health.

loans.name: Maysara

texts.ru:
Майсара одна из жителей района Вахш. Вахш находится в Хатлонской области. Жители района Вахша трудолюбивые, жизнелюбивые и ответственные. Майсара на районе занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Она выращивает помидоры и кукуруза. Майсара 10 лет своей жизни занята этой деятельностью. Она еще занимается животноводством во дворе. 
Майсара замужем и мать четверых детей. Ей в работе помогает ее дети. Муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. У Майсаре есть большой земельный участок. Она ни смотря, ни на что трудится, чтобы прокормить семью. Сейчас Майсаре нужно обработать землю минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить богатый и здоровый урожай. Из-за нехватки денежных средств Майсара обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Maysara is one of the residents of the Vakhsh region. Vakhsh is situated in Khatlon Province. All of the residents of the Vakhsh region are hard-working, full of life, and responsible. Maysara farms in the area. She grows tomatoes and corn. Maysara has been engaged in this activity for the past ten years of her life. She also rears animals in her yard.

Maysara is married and the mother of four children. Her children help her to work. Her husband is away working in the Russian Federation. Maysara has a large plot of land. She will do any amount of work necessary to feed her family. Now Maysara needs to treat her land with mineral fertilizer in order to get a rich and healthy harvest. Maysara has applied for a loan due to a lack of funds.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Thank you lenders! You are such a great help to Salvacion. What you have lent her recently was able to help her in providing for the daily expenses of her household and developing her business (sari-sari store).   

As her business expands, she would like to take out again a loan worth PHP 10,000. She would use this to buy additional products to sell like grocery supplies and other similar products. You have once proved to her that God has been faithful in her life. She believes that you would help her again this time. 

Someday, she hopes to help her siblings finish their studies. She prays also that their business will eventually grow and expand. Salvacion meets up with her fellowship group* to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell like grocery items and other similar products.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Meet Emerita.   There is nothing she dreams but to help her family and develop her business. This is why, she's very been into her business to earn and save money. She is operating a sari-sari(variety) store and recently, she was granted a loan worth PHP 15,000 that she used to improve the enterprise. 

To help her grow the business, she needs additional financial assistance. It would be better if you let her take a loan worth PHP 15,000 that she will utilize in buying more merchandise products to sell like grocery items, toys, toiletries, beverages and other items needed in her business.Thank you in advance for your generosity and heartfelt concern for people her. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to sell like grocery items, toys, toiletries, beverages and other items needed in her business.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees  is a 47-year-old married woman who sells animals. She buys young goats & calves at low prices, raises them, and then sells them  at higher prices. She  contributes financially to the family's income. She earns additional income selling milk. 

She needs to improve her business to pay household expenses. She applied for 45,000 PKR  to purchase more animals and increase sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. The loan will help her to  expand her business and income.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Tehmina

texts.en:
Tehmina is a young farmer living in Azatavan, a village of the Ararat region, with her parents. Her two brothers live and work as migrant workers in a neighbouring country.

Together with her parents, Tehmina earns a living by land cultivation. They have two greenhouses and also arable land, where they cultivate different types of crops and fruits. Tehmina now asks for this loan to pay for fertilizer and pesticides and to cover labor costs for land cultivation work.

As this is Tehmina's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Tehmina get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and pesticides and to cover labor costs for land cultivation work

loans.name: Wengeline

texts.en:
Wengeline is 27 years old and a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Wengeline has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. Wengeline requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Wengeline has been in this business for three years. In the future, Wengeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is married and the mother of two.  She and her husband are selling fish in the winter and watermelons and fruits in summers.  With the help of her fourth loan, she developed their business and since this is the beginning of summer she is planning to buy more watermelons and summer fruits, to sell them and make more money. 


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Fatma hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Eşi ile beraber kışın balık satıyor, yazında karpuz ve yaz meyveleri 
satarak evini geçindiriyor.  Mikro krediden dördüncü kredisini kullanıyor.  Aldığı kredi ile işlerini büyüttü yaz sezonu geldiği için karpuz ve yaz meyveleri alarak satışlarına devam edip para kazanmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy more watermelons and summer fruits

loans.name: Marvori

texts.ru: Марвори 23 летняя молодая рукодельница. Она из района Вахш. Марвори в районе живет вместе отцом, матерью, сестренкой и племянникам. У Марвори только средняя образования. Она после окончания школы решила заняться шитьем женской одежды. Это работа очень подходит Марвори. Ей в швейном деле нравится ежедневный доход и обожает сшить. Ее родители решили отремонтировать дом и улучшить жилищные условия. Но для ремонта не хватает денежных средств, и Марвори решила взять кредит и помочь родителям отремонтировать дом. С такими планами Марвори просит кредит. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Marvori is a young 23-year-old seamstress. She is from the Vakhsh region. Marvori lives in the area with her father, mother, sister and nephews. Marvori only has a secondary education. After graduating from school she decided to sew women's clothes. This work really suits Marvori. What she likes about the sewing business is getting daily income, and she loves to sew. Her parents have decided to renovate their house and improve their living conditions, but they have insufficient funds and Marvori has decided to take a loan to help her parents to renovate the house. With such plans Marvori is asking for a loan. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Oliya

texts.ru:
Это Олия. Она бизнес-леди. Ей 51 лет. Олия сильная и активная женщина. Она не чувствует усталость и всегда думает двигаться вперед. Таких прекрасных женщин мало встречаешь. Олия занимается торговлей деятельности. У нее есть продуктовый магазин, где она продает продукт питания и парфюмерия. На фотографии снята Олия и ее магазин. 
У  Олия 2 сыновья и 2 дочери. Сыновья женаты. Ее дети хорошо воспитанные и самостоятельные. Ей в работе помогают ее дети. Олия 15 лет продвигает свою любимую работу. Она решила расширить торговую деятельность. Олия планирует взять кредит и за счет кредита привозит другие продукты питания на продажу. С такими планами Олия обратилась  за кредитом. Олия надеется на Вашу поддержку. И только Вы можете помочь ей достичь своих целей.
texts.en:
This is Oliya. She is a businesswoman. She is 51 years old. Oliya is a strong and active woman. She does not feel fatigue and always thinks about moving forwards. One encounters few such wonderful women. Oliya is a trader. She has a grocery store where she sells produce and perfumes. Oliya and her store are depicted in the photograph.

Oliya has two sons and two daughters. Her sons are married. Her children were raised well and are independent. Her children help her work. Oliya has been doing her favorite work for 15 years. She has decided to expand her trading business. Oliya plans to take a loan and use it to bring in other produce for sale. With such plans Oliya has applied for a loan. Oliya hopes for your support. Only you can help her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to bring in other produce to expand her business.

loans.name: Scola

texts.en:
Scola is a married woman with two children, both in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation.
With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lease land for planting grass for her livestock and for a cow shed.

loans.name: Voskehat

texts.en:
Voskehat is farmer living in Aygehovit village of the Tavush region. With her two sons , ages 16 and 17, Voskehat works hard to develop her farming business. She keep livestock consisting of two cows, two sows and piglets, as well as 15 hens.
Voskehat also cultivates corn and maintains a grape vineyard. She has applied for this loan to purchase forage for the livestock and natural pesticides for grape orchard to sustain the farm. 
This is Voskehat's second loan. Unfortunately the first loan, which she got from a local financial institution, was very difficult to repay and Voskehat faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, Voskehat and her sons have been able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. Voskehat has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and no access to credit products.

Voskehat plans to invest the income from the loan to increase her livestock and to have the opportunity to improve her material well-being.

loans.use: to buy forage for the livestock and natural pesticides for her grape vineyard.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen  is a 27-year-old married woman with 6 children,  who has sold milk selling for many years. She has buffalos and sells the milk locally. Her business contributes to the family’s expenses.  

She has taken previous loans from Kashf Foundation and requests 45,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase milk sales.  She wants to provide better living conditions to her children.  She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Arise And Shine Group

texts.en:
These 4 hardworking women belong to the Arise group. They sell yams, coco yam, napkins, kitchen sets, and second hand clothing. Ophelia is a 42-year-old married woman with four children and lives in the town of Teshie in the greater Accra region of Ghana. 

She has sold napkins and kitchen sets for 10 years. Ophelia wants to expand her business and requests a loan from ID Ghana to buy more napkins and kitchen sets to sell to customers. This loan will help her to generate greater profits, pay school fees for her children, and maintain her home. The members of the group hold each other responsible for repaying the loan. 

Ophelia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy  napkins and kitchen sets.

loans.name: Hadeesan

texts.en:
Hadeesan is a 35-year-old married woman who has been running an animal purchase and sales business with the help of her husband for many years. 

Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is the mother of four children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en: Uzma  is a single woman who has run her own beauty parlor  She is very passionate about her work and knows the techniques of makeup and hair design. She also sells bangles and jewelry and is a well-known beautician in town. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. She requests 45,000 PKR  to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits, and lightening creams.

loans.use: to buy lotions, makeup kits, and lightening creams.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is a 45-year-old married woman who runs an animal sales business. She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

Hamida needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 32 year old Lebanese married mother of four children’s. In 2011, Zeinab started her own business, by opening in her house a small room for vending lingerie with her special selling methods and by giving a high quality of products provided. She is well-known in her region with the special talents in her domain. 

Today, Zeinab is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to increase her business merchandise with a special new collections, to meet the needs of her clients in order to increase her income. Zeinab is very proud of her business growth and she hopes to expand her earnings.

loans.use: to increase her lingerie merchandise with special new collections

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fast-moving items to sell

loans.name: Khanisa

texts.ru: Ханисе 19 лет. Она жительница района  Вахш. Ханиса живет вместе отцом, матерью и сестренкой. Она уже самостоятельная девушка, сама старается зарабатывать на жизнь и помочь родителям обеспечить семью. Ее родители гордиться за ней, и очень рады, что у них есть такая дочка.  Ханиса 1 год продвигает швейную деятельность. Она уже набрала опыта, чтобы продвигать деятельность на новый уровень. Но ей нужна новая швейная машинка для бизнеса. Потому, что ее старая швейная машинка устарела, и не выполняет свои функции хорошо.  Ханиса хочет взять кредит и за счет кредита приобрести новую швейную машинку. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет приобрести необходимые средства и продвигать бизнес на новый уровень. Она ждет Вашу доброту.
texts.en: Khanisa is 19 years old. She is a resident of the Vakhsh region. Khanisa lives with her father, mother and sister. She is already an independent girl, and strives to make a living and help her parents to provide for the family. Her parents are proud of her, and they are very glad that they have such a daughter. Khanisa has been sewing for a year. She has already gained enough experience to take her work to a new level. But she needs a new sewing machine for the business because her old sewing machine has worn out and does not perform its functions well. Khanisa wants to take a loan and use it to buy a new sewing machine. The requested loan will help her to acquire the necessary equipment and take her business to a new level. She is looking forward to your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Judith Jiovanna

texts.es:
Judith tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es muy tranquila y armoniosa, la población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de belleza como perfumes, talcos, cremas corporales, entre otros, su negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio. Cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos para aumentar su stock como perfumes, talcos, cremas corporales y ropa para su negocio. Con esto Judith espera aumentar el stock de productos de su tienda para poder satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Judith is 24 years old, single, and lives in her own home in the district of Cayaltí, which is in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú. Life in the community is very calm and harmonious. The people who live here make a living mainly in agriculture, livestock and commerce. 

Judith makes a living selling clothing and beauty products such as perfumes, powders, body lotions, among others. Her business is located in her home. She has 3 years of experience in this business and very good personal and work references in the area. The loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of products to increase the stock of products like perfumes, powders, body lotions and clothing for her business. With the loan, Judith hopes to increase the product stock in her shop to be able to satisfy the tastes and necessities of her clients, which will have a positive impact on her income level and thus on her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of products to increase the stock for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase jembes (digging hoe), maize seed and fertilizer to improve her harvest and meet family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lease land to expand her farming activity .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stocks of tomatoes, onions and vegetables for sell and hopes this will enable her to make more profits and be able to support her family.

loans.name: Tehmine

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Tehmine from Aragats village. She lives with her husband and two little sons (6 and 4-years-old). 

As a main source of income for her family, she works with field crop cultivation, after having started 10 years ago. Thanks to Tehmine's and her husband's persistent work, they currently get good harvests of potato, cabbage and greens and sell them in the market. Tehmine and her husband have a dream to expand their land cultivation work and gather more harvest. Tehmine asks this loan to purchase some arable land and be able to make their dream come true. 

As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Tehmine get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses.
 
Tehmine hopes to receive lenders' support ensuring responsible monthly payments.

loans.use: to pay for arable land to expand agribusiness

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business. With the loan she is requesting, to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is a 56-year-old seasoned entrepreneur who has run a number of businesses over the years, ranging from distributing recycling material, rentingto  trucks, and supplying meat to his community. 

He is an energetic man who is ambitious and passionate about business. He has supplied meat door to door for 5 years and has steadily grown his customer base to include small restaurants and mobile caterers. However,he is facing difficulties with his business model. He carries the meat in a bucket distributing it by foot from house to house. This is both time-consuming and very tiring on his aging body. "I can only do a handful of deliveries a day as I am limited to my neighborhood" says Jaime.

He now wants to convert a backroom in his yard into a butcher shop. This will enable him to stock more meat and serve more customers while also taking the strain off his body. Jaime however does not want to inconvenience his loyal customers and intends to hire a helper who will carry on with the work of supplying door-to-door. 

He requests a loan to buy paint, iron sheets, window panes, glass display units, an electronic scale, and a mincer. This equipment will help him convert the room into a well-equipped butchery.

loans.use: to buy paint, iron sheets, window panes, a display unit, an electronic scale, and  a mincer.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida has successfully built her business of milk sales with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By the time she attained good number of customers and makes good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. 

Now she has applied a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another cow to increase her sales to a larger area and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her sales to a larger area and to gain more profits.

loans.name: Spice Girls Group

texts.en:
Maureen is the featured borrower of Spice Girls group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon with a better income to support their beloved ones back home.

Maureen is a 38-year-old single mother of two children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions.  So she is acquiring a Loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees. Maureen is the second lady on the left of the photo.  With respect to the other group members, Omaira is the first lady on the left, Helen is the second lady on the right, and Roxan is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm tools such as jembes and fertilizers for preparing his farm for planting, so as to get a better harvest and meet family needs.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to resell for her buy and sell dried fish business.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 10 years. Rosemarie earns more income from food vending.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to resell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Cecilia works hard to support her family.

She has a selling coconut wine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell to her customers for her selling coconut wine business.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell to her customers

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a married mother of one child,  who attends school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is married, and has two kids who attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry farming business which earns her income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbours. Her major challenges is seasonality .

With the Ksh 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business .

loans.use: to  purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida, who is in her early 60's, is married with two children who are all grown-up. She is staying with her grandchild who is still in school. She has been selling charcoal for six months now. She works from from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Frida's nineth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to sell cooking oil called alizet, but has stopped selling that oil because of waiting for the harvest. So she started selling charcoal. She has paid back all her loans successfully. Frida is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay school fees for the grandchild, for loan repayment and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to resell. She dreams of selling alizeti again.

Frida will make sure she pays the loan at the scheduled time.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and cabbages

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 48 year old married woman of two children. Her husband is the main income source in the family.  He owns a gas station in his town and as for her, she does not work, but cares only for her home and family. 

Today, in order to pay her son's school fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She is a permanent customer and she insist that she will always ask for Kiva’s support to ensure a good educational path for her son.

loans.use: to pay her son's school fees

loans.name: Silvester

texts.en:
Silvester 41 years old, is married and supports 3 children. He is a dairy farmer and supplies milk to his customers. He will be using the loan to buy dairy feeds such as fodder, nappier grass and hay for his dairy cows as well as a cow shed and hopes this will enable him to get more milk for sell. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His future hopes are to buy more dairy cows, make more income and support his family.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds such as fodder, nappier grass and hay for his dairy cows, as well as a cow shed and hopes this will enable him to get more milk for sell.

loans.name: Pedra

texts.en:
Pedra is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell recyclable materials  business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase more recyclable materials to sell for her buy and sell recyclable materials  business.

Pedra has been in this business for 11 years. Pedra earns more income from selling nipa roofing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Pedra has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more recyclable materials to sell

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat

loans.name: Arpine

texts.en:
Arpine, her husband and two kids live in Verishen village of Syuniq region.

Arpine's husband works as a driver in the local village, but his salary is barely enough for covering family's basic needs. Arpine herself runs their family farm. She keeps livestock of cows, piglets and hens and also cultivates beans, potato and some grass as a forage for the livestock.  Arpine likes her farm and is happy to have it. She applied for this loan to purchase three cows and enlarge her farm. 

As this is Arpine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Arpine get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Arpine hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for three cows to enlarge the farm

loans.name: Akotobu Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth (standing second from the left in the photo), age about 58 years old, is the group representative of a three member group from Teshie township situated in Accra, Ghana. Her family is comprised of her and her daughter. Elizabeth is maintaining her family by selling secondhand clothing. She has been selling secondhand clothing in another town. She is a very active woman, who wants some more money out of her own efforts. 

At present, Elizabeth's monthly income is good, but not sufficient to maintain her family. So she, along with two other members, decided to come and avail themselves of a loan from ID Ghana to improve their businesses. From the present loan, she will purchase different kinds of secondhand clothing to sell to customers. She will earn some extra income to maintain a better life. The three are doing different businesses in their locality.

loans.use: To purchase different kinds of secondhand clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Blessing Group

texts.en:
Blessing is a group of four hardworking members, all of whom live in the same district and have different income-generating activities in different places. They are into the sale of soft drinks, grocery, enamel bowls, plastic items and an ice chest. 

The group representative is called Esi, and she has been part of this group for two years now. She is a 46-year-old married mother and has children. The group is on its third loan cycle, and she is requesting this sum to buy soft drinks to sell to customers. Her husband helps her with the daily goings on in the sale of her products. She has more than 10 years of experience in her business, and starts her day at 7.30 am, finishing at 8 pm. 

In the future she would like to be a distributor of these products, be financially autonomous, and spread to other markets. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 48 years old, married with one child.

Teodora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, noodles, eggs, cereals, etc. to sell.

Teodora has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Teodora aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, noodles, eggs, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Joan is 24 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Joan has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Joan requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready to wear to sell.

Joan has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Joan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: A 48 ans, Abla est une femme mariée et avec ses six enfants, elle vit dans le quartier de Hédzranawoé. Abla est une marchande de chaussures qui se promène dans les rues de son quartier afin de bien vendre. Abla s’approvisionne deux fois par mois dans un marché local. Abla réalise une très bonne rentabilité dans son commerce. Abla nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des chaussures afin de gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Abla, 48 years old, is a married woman who lives with her six children in the Hédzranawoé district. She is a vendor of shoes who goes from street to street in her district, so as to do well with her sales. She gets her supplies twice a month at the local market. Abla makes a very good profit in her commerce. She needs this loan to purchase some shoes in order to earn a profit and help out her children with their education.

loans.use: to purchase 2 boxes of shoes

loans.name: Arise And Shine 2 Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Arise and Shine 2. The group is composed of four women living with their families. On average, they are 35 years of age with two children. They all live in Teshie, a city of Accra. They know each other through local “susu” (neighborhood savings group) and through their work. The group members work as vendors selling soft drinks, groceries, tea, bread, noodles, ice chests, food warmers and flasks. 

With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to join ID-Ghana and are on their ninth loan cycle. Joana is well known as a flask, food warmer and ice chest seller. She plans to use this loan to buy more flasks, food warmers and ice chests to sell to customers. She stocks up in Accra. She resells in Teshie, for cash, to a mixed customer base. With this loan, Joana plans to earn a monthly revenue which will be used to provide for her family needs, with the rest invested in her business. She is married and has three children.

loans.use: To buy more flasks, food warmers and ice chests to sell to customers.

loans.name: Cesiri Group

texts.fr:
Bakary est le Monsieur  qui  tient la corne du bélier sur la photo.
Bakary est  un  malien  non scolarisé. Il est âgé de  35  ans, marié Père de 07 enfants, âgés de 2 mois à  14 ans dont  1 est  scolarisé. Sa femme est une ménagère. 
 Bakary  fait  l’élevage des béliers. Il prend le prêt avec le RMCR pour acheter  beaucoup  de béliers. Il s’approvisionne  dans  les foires environnantes  et revend  dans les foires lointaines.   Il  a une expérience de 12 ans  d’activité.
 Dans ses ventes, il gagne en moyenne  15000 FCFA de profit par Béliers. Avec le profit, Bakary  pourra subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (habillement, santé et frais de scolarité).  Il est souvent confronté aux  couts élevé  des frais de transport   mais organise généralement  le voyage avec  certains éleveurs  de sa localité pour relever le défi.
Son rêve  est de  gagner plus de profit afin de s’acheter un terrain en ville à usage d’habitation pour sa  famille.
texts.en:
Bakary is the gentleman holding the horn of the ram in the photo. He is a uneducated Malian, 35 years old, and a married father of seven children, aged 2 months to 14 years old. One of the children is in school. Bakary’s wife is a homemaker, while he raises sheep. He is taking out a loan with RMCR to purchase many rams. He gets his supplies from the nearby fairs and resells at fairs located far away. He has twelve years of experience in this business. 

Upon making his sales, he earns a profit of 15,000 francs CFA per ram, on average. With the profits, he will be able to meet the needs of his family (clothing, healthcare, schooling costs). He is often confronted with high transportation costs, but he generally organizes trips with certain livestock farmers in his town to meet the challenge. His dream is to earn more profit, so as to buy a residential plot of land in town for his family.

loans.use: to purchase rams to resell later

loans.name: Zaruhi

texts.en:
Zaruhi comes from the village of Jrahovit village in the Ararat region. The climate in that region is ideal for fruit cultivation.  Zaruhi cultivates tomatoes and greens. Together with her family members, Zaruhi also is involved in dried fruit production. She lives with parents-in-law. two brothers-in-law, husband and two kids. Agriculture is the family's main occupation and income from it is very important for them. 

Zaruhi asks this loan to invest in this agribusiness. She plans to purchase fertilizer, natural pesticides and raw materials for dried fruit production. 

This is Zaruhi's second loan. Unfortunately the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions, was very difficult to return back, and there were  some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, Zaruhi and her family have been able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

Zaruhi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, natural pesticides, raw materials for dried fruit production

loans.name: Jose Dario Henao Tobon

texts.es:
Él es Darío es un productor agropecuario de 49 años de edad el cual toda su vida ha estado vinculado con actividades del campo, Darío está en busca de ayuda y tu puedes extenderle tu mano pues necesita capital para la compra de un motor para la maquina cortadora (ver foto) y compra de abonos, insecticidas y semillas para la siembra.

Este hombre que sido tan trabajador, busca el apoyo porque no tiene capital y al ser la máquina y la agricultura las actividades que le generar sus sustento diario se ve en la obligación de solicitar el préstamo el cual se compromete a pagar puntualmente.

El objetivo de Darío es trabajar fuertemente durante 10 años para comprar el terreno donde actualmente vive con su pareja y que habita desde el año 1997.
texts.en:
Dario is a 49 year old agricultural producer whose entire life has been linked to working in the country. Dario is seeking a helping hand as he needs capital for the purchase of a motor for a cutting machine (pictured) and to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds for planting. 

He's been a very hard-working man and seeks support because he lacks the capital. The jobs the machine and agriculture generate sustain his daily life, and thus he is obligated to request a loan which he promises to repay with punctuality. Dario's objective is to work hard for 10 years to purchase the land where he currently lives with his partner dating back to 1997.

loans.use: purchase of a motor for a cutting machine (pictured) and to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 41 ans qui vit dans le quartier de Hédzranawoé pour entreprendre son activité. Mère de cinq enfants, Afi vend des céréales dans le quartier pour subvenir aux divers besoins. Afi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Afi demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de maïs afin de bien vendre et avoir plus de bénéfice. Afi désire réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Afi is a married woman, 41 years old, who lives in the Hédzranawoé district to carry out her work. The mother of five, she sells grains in the district to meet her various needs. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market. Afi is asking for this loan to put in an order for sacks of corn, so as to do well in her sales and to have more profit. Her wish is to make profits for supporting her husband in cover family expenses and allowing her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of corn

loans.name: Nableme

texts.fr: Agée de 32 ans, Nableme est une femme mariée qui vit à Attiégou avec trois enfants à sa charge. Dans son quartier, Nableme vend des céréales et de la pate de manioc à ses clients et trouve son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins, Nableme s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Nableme demande ce crédit pour commander des bols de sorgho, de farine de blé et de manioc afin de réaliser encore plus de revenus pour soutenir  les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Nableme, aged 32, is a married woman who lives in Attiégou with three children in her care. In her district, Nableme sells grains and cassava dough to her customers. She makes an income thanks to this commerce. To respond effectively to the need, she gets her supplies once a month at the market. Nableme is asking for this loan to put in an order for tubs of sorghum, wheat flour, and cassava flour, so as to make more income for supporting her family day to day.

loans.use: to purchase 40 tubs of sorghum, 65 tubs of wheat flour, and 2 tubs of cassava flour

loans.name: Chi Roseline

texts.en:
Chi Roseline is married and blessed with three children who go to school. She lives in a three bedroom house in the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life, which are the death of her younger sister, the death of her mother, also her daughter was raped and the disappearance of her nephew, which has made life so difficult for her.   

She was motivated to become a member of GHAPE by her friends and relatives who have been GHAPE members since 2010. She has successfully borrowed and repaid loans three times. 

With this new loan she is going to buy bunches of plantain and banana. She will also buy firewood and pay for splitting. She knows her business is going to succeed because she has been doing it for long, others have been succeeding and she will buy quality products and have a good business site. With this business activity the community will benefit from quality products, moderate prices, reduce the distance to market and goods will be available on time.

The profit from this loan helps her pay for her children's school fees and provide some basic food for the family, pay for family’s medication, plough back some of the profit and buy a plot to build a house for her family.  She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rate and convenience

loans.use: to buy bunches of plantain and banana. She will also buy firewood and pay for splitting.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Henedina

texts.en:
Henedina busies herself with selling assorted products. She is able to support her husband with providing for their daily needs and the education of their four children. 

Henedina sells cosmetics, lingerie, clothing apparel and beauty and health products to her neighbors and the local community. She wants to expand her business to purchase more inventory to sell. 

She has reached out to Paglaum MPC for funding needs and applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP. She is happy to earn a good income each month. She hopes to open her own shop in the future in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian has a food vending business in Olingan, Dipolog, Philippines. This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. Lilian has local customers and also accepts orders for additional income. 

Recently she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her business. 

She wants to expand her business and would be happy to be able to open a small eatery.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her business

loans.name: Giovanni

texts.en:
Giovanni is 19 years old; he is single and he doesn't have children. He lives at his parent's house. 

Giovanni is learning about how to be a technician. He is working at a private company and he needs a loan to buy tools. 

Giovanni helps at his house with the expenses; his father is unemployed and his mother is a housewife so he needs your help. He is the only person that earns money at his home. 

In the picture, Giovanni is at the place where he works.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Twenty-five-year-old Shanti lives in a small village of Alipurduar with her family, comprising her husband Naresh, two sons, and one daughter. Both Shanti and her husband do not have a formal education, but they can sign their names. All her children attend school.

Her husband is a motor mechanic, but his income is inconsistent. Shanti gives financial support to her husband by selling milk and cattle byproducts like cow dung in her local area. Her neighbors are the main customers. Now she decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase another dairy cow and its fodder so that she can sell more milk to increase her family's income.

She is struggling a lot to earn money so that her children do not suffer from poverty. Shanti is very courageous and ambitious to start her own business because she is confident that she can give her children a good education and run the family smoothly with the profit from her dairy business. She is very obliged to BJS and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and fodder for her dairy business.

loans.name: God Is Able 2 Group

texts.en:
The three women who make up the God Is Able 2 group live in nuclear families in the Teshie neighborhood in Accra. They average 48 years of age and three children each. The women know one another through community ties, kinship, marriage and their revenue-generating businesses in the district. 

They each have small-scale businesses involving second-hand clothing, kenkey (cook corn paste), yam, sweet potatoes, fish and materials. With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to join the micro finance institution ID-Ghana and are now on their eighth loan cycle. 

Esther (standing in the middle of the photo) is a major vendor of kenkey (cook corn paste) and second-hand clothing. She intends to use her loan to purchase kenkey (cook corn paste) and second-hand clothing in the market at Accra. Her sales are made to a mixed customer base, paying with cash. She operates this business at her residence on a pavement. 

With this loan, Esther hopes to make a good monthly profit that will be used to meet her needs and to increase her capital. She would like to continue collaborating with ID-Ghana. She is single, 49 years old, and lives alone.

loans.use: To purchase kenkey (cook corn paste) and second-hand clothing in the market at Accra.

loans.name: Trọng

texts.en:
Trọnh works in agriculture farming food. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Trọng is 36 years old and he is married with 2 children. He lives with two dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Trọng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns his is not having hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

With his business profit he wants his business to do well and to make enough money to provide for his kids. He also hopes for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Aurea Mercedita

texts.en:
Aurea Mercedita is 55 years old and currently lives with her husband and four children. She is very responsible and hardworking with her household obligations, since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. 

For a living, Aurea Mercedita and her husband are both farmers who plant rice, corn, root crops and beans. 

Aurea Mercedita wants to live in a decent house. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase light construction materials, such as plywood and sticks, for her house. 

In the future, she deeply hopes to see all her children with stable financial status.

loans.use: to purchase light construction materials, such as plywood and sticks, for her house

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 42 years old, and married with three children. Two of her children are in school.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Arlene has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store of 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Arlene aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Denia May

texts.en:
Denia May is 41 years old; she is married with five children. Three of her children are in school.

Denia May works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell.

Denia May has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Denia May aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Antoninha

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Antoninha to improve her business.

She is married and she has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, water, fish, candles, slippers, beer and Coca Cola. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. 

Running a business has made Antoninha independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family.

She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, water, fish, candles, slippers, beer and Coca Cola

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda is happy tending her little store. She is married with three adult-aged children. The store is her means of earning a living to help support her husband, who provides income for their family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. Luzminda keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. She believes that with PMPC's support, as one family, they will sustain themselves and beat the competition. Luzminda has reached her fourth year being a member of Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase additional inventory for the store. Expanding her inventory of canned goods, sugar, milk, and biscuits will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hard-working mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there, a better quality of life she could provide for all of those in the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for the store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase jembes, maize seeds and fertilizers for planting so as to get a better harvest and meet family needs

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
Simplicia is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various items. Her husband is a farmer focusing on rice farming, and he manages a small piggery. Simplicia is a full-fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance.

Simplicia wants to repair her house to live comfortably with her family. Recently, she applied for a loan. This loan is intended to purchase light construction materials such as plywood, nails and sticks. She is on her way to repairing her house.

loans.use: to purchase light construction materials such as plywood, nails and sticks

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 38 years old and lives in Calaran, Calamba. She earns a living offering manicure/pedicure services. She has been in this business for about five years and is well known for the nice quality of services she offers.

She has already purchased some new manicure sets and was able to save from this investment. Her service is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 3,000 per month.

Naomi is seeking a PHP 10,000 loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase special items for her foot spa services. In her previous loans she has never had a delinquency. Naomi is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to the effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to purchase special items for her foot spa services

loans.name: Emerinciana

texts.en: Emerinciana hoped for good fortune when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could request financial assistance for her chosen business. Emerinciana has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase piglets that she can feed and sell. Emerinciana wishes to continue to manage her business more effectively with the support of her family. Someday, she hopes to repair her house and to provide her family a safe and decent living standard.

loans.use: to purchase piglets that she can feed and sell

loans.name: Asesewa Group

texts.en:
The Asesewa Group is made up of three women. of whom one is married and the other two are single. They average 35 years old and have two children. They live in extended families in a neighborhood in Teshie, Accra. The women know one another through neighborhood, family and business ties. 

They sell cooking utensils, banku (cooked corn and cassava paste), fish, slippers and sponge. They want to improve their stock levels. The group works with Kiva's field partner, ID Ghana. This will be their third group loan. 

Ruth (standing on the far right in the photo) is well known for selling cooking utensil. She plans to use her loan to buy more cooking utensil from Accra to sell to her customers in Teshie. Ruth expects to earn a good monthly profit, which will be used to pay for healthcare for her children. She hopes to use this partnership with ID Ghana to increase the size of her business.

loans.use: To buy more cooking utensil from Accra to sell to her customers in Teshie.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle works hard to support her family. Michelle is married and has a selling herbal and natural products business in the Philippines.

Michelle requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.

Michelle has been in this business for 4 years now.

Michelle would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more herbal stocks to sell

loans.name: Ramkumar

texts.en:
Ram is 54 years old and is a rice farmer. He lives together with his wife and 4 school-aged children. Ram is a regular customer of Seva MFI and repays his loans always on time.
He now wants to hire an excavator to level his rice plot and needs a loan of SRd 5000. With leveling his rice plots, he will have fewer problems and the water will be managed better. By doing so, he expects better output and more profits.  With those profits, he will be able to pay for the tuition fees for his children.

loans.use: To hire an excavator to level his rice plot.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Noujoud

texts.en:
Noujoud is a 41 year old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children. Her husband works as an employee in a company to satisfy the requirements of life and until now he earns a barely fair income. 

For that reason, today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children’s educational fees. She said that the loan will surely help her to register her children with the coming school year, that makes her very happy.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is single, but she supports her family.  The income from the rice land is just enough for hand-to-mouth needs, and she was striving hard to earn a living without a stable job. The medication of her mother and the day-to-day consumption was challenging, so she decided to open a store selling basic commodities.  

They were thankful that they joined Paglaum MPC. With very little capital, they were able to start their sari-sari (general store) business. Their daily sales go the extra mile for the family's needs. They were also able to save with their extra income. They have applied to Paglaum MPC for additional capital of PHP 6,000. They say they were attracted to Paglaum MPC for its savings and insurance services of the cooperative. They want to gradually expand their little store and taste a good life someday.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to retail

loans.name: Jasinta

texts.en:
Jasinta is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. In addition she also operates a poultry business selling to the neighbours. She faces a major challenge of transportation
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Edna works hard to support her family. She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines and also earns  income from rice retailing. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell to customers.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Fricel

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Fricel works hard to support her family. She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Fricel is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

Fricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save money to expand her business and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Maria Rosalba

texts.es:
María Rosalba es una agricultura de 49 años de edad, que asumió las riendas del cultivo de papas de la familia debido al fallecimiento de su esposo un hecho lamentable el cual debía superar rápido para mostrar fortaleza a su hijo.

Desde aquel hecho lamentable María Rosa se dedica al cultivo de papas, su hijo de 15 años de edad le ha ayudado mucho, entre los dos se valen para generar el sustento del hogar y quieren convertirse en la mayor agricultora de papa de la región en honor a su esposo.

María Rosalba y su hijo han realizado un excelente trabajo ahora están creciendo y buscan un apoyo para expandir su cultivo.

Junto con su hijo María Rosalba se encuentra solicitando un apoyo el cual invertirán en la compra de semillas de papas, riegos, abonos y pago de mano de obra para crear los canales de cultivo.
texts.en:
María Rosalba is a 49 year old farmer who assumed the helm growing potatoes for her family as her husband passed away. She had to get over this sad fact rapidly to show strength to her son. Since that regrettable event María Rosalba has worked growing potatoes and her 15 year old son helps her a lot. Between the two of them they manage to generate the sustenance for their household and they want to become the biggest potato farmers in the region to honor her husband.

María Rosalba and her son have done an excellent job and are growing and looking for support to expand their crops. Together with her son María Rosalba is requesting a loan which she will invest in buying potato seeds, irrigation, manure and to pay for labor to create the crop rows.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, irrigation, manure and to pay for labor to create the crop furrows.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2011, and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. To earn a living, she has managed a small retailing business to sustain her family's needs. Narcisa is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. She has a small piece of farmland near her home. She is preparing for the future, especially for the education of her children. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP. This loan is intended to buy farm supplies and finance her falcatta tree planting project. Narcisa dreams of nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and finance her falcatta (plywood) tree planting project

loans.name: Voldy

texts.en:
Voldy is the founder of a small company named Perle Antillaise. He produces organic peanut butter and coffee powder to sell his customers.He has already preferred manufacturing Haitian products and export them to the international market.
Having studied Business Administration, Voldy has built a strong clientele despite his academic obligations.Through this request, he wants to purchase a mill and new stock of raw materials in order to increase the local productions. 
Your contribution to this project will help Voldy create a new part-time job.

loans.use: to purchase 1 peanut butter mill, 40 dozen 16-oz. plastic jars, and 15 dozen 12-oz. glass jars.

loans.name: Jairo Cesar

texts.es:
Jairo es un hombre de 51 años de edad, se separó de su esposa dejándola con el hogar donde viven sus dos hijos de 19 y 17 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo y ahora trabaja pro un objetico que es comprar una casa propia para él.

Al tenerse que mudar para otro hogar, debió comprar los  implementos del hogar quedando con poco capital para seguir ejerciendo su profesión por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de un cerdo y así reactivar y reiniciar su profesión con pie firme una vez superado los inconvenientes personales.

El prestamos será de gran ayudara para esta gran persona que cada semana manda dinero para que su ex-familia, pueda comprar su alimentación mientras consiguen trabajo.
texts.en: Jairo is a 51 year old man. He separated from his wife leaving her the house where their two children aged 19 and 17 years old live. He works selling pork and now works with the objective of buying a house for himself. Having to move to a new place he had to buy household items and has little capital left to continue with his profession. So he is requesting a loan to buy a pig and thus reactivate and re-start his profession on a firm footing overcoming his personal problems. The loan will be of great help for this great person who every week sends money so that his ex-family can buy food while he finds work.

loans.use: to buy some pigs as he works selling pork.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Judith is 58 years old and all of her children are attend in school.

Judith has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Judith requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

Judith has been in this business for three years. In the future, Judith would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Welijaida

texts.en:
Welijaida is a 57 years old and married. She engaged in a sari-sari store business to help her husband as a farmer for a living. She aims for a better living of her family, that's why she borrowed a loan to buy more stocks for sell to increase her inventory and be able to generate more income.

Welijaida plan for the future to save money from her business income.

loans.use: To buy more grocery stocks for sell.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
Ana es una dulce abuela de 68 años de edad, madre de la sorprenden cantidad de 10 hijos y que se dedica a la cría de aves una actividad que junto con la empelada por su marido (agricultura), levantaron su numeroso hogar.

Ana desde 1995 ha desarrollado esta actividad y lo pienso seguir haciendo hasta el final de sus días o hasta que su salud se lo permita, ahora ella busca un apoyo para seguir trabajando su profesión agrícola y es que necesita un capital para invertir y no dejar caer su negocio.

El monto lo necesita para comprar una cerda de cría, comprar pollos y el alimento de los dos animales.

Su propósito es seguir generando ingresos ser autosuficiente y dejar el negocio familiar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is a 68-year-old sweet grandmother, and the mother of the surprising number of ten children. She raises poultry and together with her husband's work in agriculture, they raised their large family. 

Since 1995 Ana has been raising poultry and plans on doing so 'til her dying day or as long as her health permits. Now she is looking for support to continue with her profession in agriculture. She needs some capital to invest to keep her business running. She will use the money to buy a breeding sow, chickens and  feed for these animals. Her aim is to continue generating income, be self-sufficient, and to leave the family business to her children.

loans.use: to buy a breeding sow, chickens, and feed for them.

loans.name: Mercedes Candelaria

texts.es:
Mercedes, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y se dedica a los oficios domesticos, no estudio porque no tenía los recursos necesarios; su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y la ganaderia, tienen tres hijos, pero ninguno depende de ella. 

Mercedes, trabaja en los oficios domésticos, solo su esposo y sus hijos son los que tabajan. 

Ella, necesita un crédito para comprar ganado y dejarselo a sus hijos como capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 57 years old, is married, and does household work. She does not have an education because she lacked the finances to do so. Her husband works in agriculture and raises livestock. They have three children, none of whom are dependent on her. 

Mercedes does household work, so only her husband and children work. She is requesting a loan to buy cattle to give to her children as working capital.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 58 years old and married with one child. Arsenia works very hard to provide for them.

Arsenia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Arsenia has been in this business for 17 years. 

In the future, Arsenia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Iris

texts.es:
Buscando una mejor calidad, tener un hogar estable económicamente con su pareja la joven Iris inicio con su negocio de cría de cerdos desde el año 2013, este primer periodo de tiempo ha sido de adaptación, de conseguir clientes, de mirar cómo se maneja un negocio etc.

El negocio no solo fue pensando para generar ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar, ella tiene sus propios proyectos, quiere tener una empresa auto sostenible, estudiar, comprar una casa para sus padres, su menta está abierta a miles de ideas que conforme va pasando el tiempo va ejecutando.

En vista de aumentar la cantidades de animales, numero de cocheras, número de ventas, ser una fuerte competidora Iris quiere solicitar un apoyo económica el cual destinara en la compra de materiales para la construcción de una cochera, (tubos, cemento, adobes), compra de ceros + alimento.
texts.en:
Looking for better quality of life, and to have a financially stable home with her partner, the young Iris began her pig breeding business in 2013. During this initial period she has adapted her business, obtained customers, and discovered how to run a business, etc. 

The business was not only formed to generate revenue to maintain her home; she also has her own projects, and she wants to have a sustainable business, study, and buy a house for her parents. Her mind is open to many ideas that come with time.

In order to increase the numbers of animals, sheds, sales, and her competitiveness, Iris wants to apply for a loan to buy materials to construct a shed (pipes, cement, bricks), to buy pigs, and purchase food.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a shed (pipes, cement, bricks), to buy pigs, and purchase food.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Andrea is 48 years old and has one child who is in school.

Andrea has a general store business in the Philippines. Andrea requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like canned good, soft-drinks, noodles and other groceries.

Andrea has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Andrea would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned good, soft-drinks, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Yaneira Rosa

texts.es:
Yaneira es una joven de 25 años de edad, madre de dos hermosas princesas de 6 y 3 años de edad, inicio un negocio propia buscando una vida como independiente, generar recursos y estar cerca de sus hijas el cual es una carnicería que con este año ajusta 4 años de operación y ha crecido exponencialmente desde entonces. 

Las ganas de salir delante de brindar un mejor futuro a sus hijas, de tener vivienda propia, de pagar la educación de sus hijos de tener un carro propio ha llevado hacen que esta mujer se esfuerce y se empeñe en lograr todos los objetivos que se propone.

Yaneira desea solicitar un préstamo para abastecer su carnicería buscando aumentar sus ventas a partir de buenos precios pues comprara en cantidades para poder rebajar el precio de libra de carne.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de pollos, reces, pescado  de alimento de cerdos, (ella misma cría los cerdos que se vende en su carnicería).
texts.en:
Yaneira is a young woman 25 years of age, and the mother of two beautiful princesses, ages 6 and 3. She began her own business seeking an independent life, by generating resources while remaining near her daughters. Yaneira operates her own butcher shop. It's been in operation for the last four years.  Since its creation, the business has expanded exponentially.

The urge to get ahead and to offer a better future for her daughters, and of having their own home, of paying for her children's education, and of having their own car has made this young woman exert herself and strive to achieve all her proposed objectives.

Yaneira is soliciting a loan to stock her butcher shop, striving to augment sales and to purchase meat at good prices by buying in sufficient quantities to lower the meat's price per pound.

Her loan will be invested in purchasing chickens, cattle, and fish-feed for pigs. (Yaneira raises the pigs that she sells in her butcher shop.)

loans.use: to buy chickens, cattle, and fish-feed for pigs (she herself raises the pigs she sells in her butcher shop).

loans.name: Ana Milena

texts.es:
Ana milena es una mujer de 38 años de edad que decidió cambiar su pensamiento y las costumbres agrícolas de su familia solo pro seguir un deseo y pasión que es la panadería, mostro mucho gusto por la elaboración de galletas, panes, bollos entre otros productos, sus comidas eran tan ricas que le sugirieron que los vendiera y ganara capital que le servía a ella para el sostenimiento y mejoras de su hogar.

Ahora Ana ve en potencial futuro en su profesión quiere realizar un préstamo para la compra de insumos que necesita para la pañería ya que los demás como endulzantes los obtiene de la tierra  y de los cultivos de su marido, su pensando es vender todo lo producido, comprar un horno, comprar una vitrina y adecuar un espacio en su casa e ir transformándolo poco a poco en una panadería que es su gran sueño.
texts.en:
Ana Milena is a 38-year-old woman who decided to change her way of thinking and the agricultural tradition of her family so that she could follow her passion which is to have a bakery. She always showed a great deal of enjoyment in making cookies, breads, rolls and other baked goods. The foods she prepared were always so tasty that everyone told her she should sell them and earn money that she could use to maintain and fix up her home.

Now Ana sees the potential in her profession and she wants to take out a loan so she can buy the supplies she needs for the bakery. The other things she needs, such as sweeteners, she gets from the land and from her husband's crops.
