Her plan is to sell everything she makes, buy an oven, buy a display case and fix up a space in her house and gradually transform it into a bakery.  This is her big dream.

loans.use: to buy the supplies she needs for her bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her store with more products.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en: Carmela is a strong-willed mother of her three children. She runs a botanical garden business in Dipolog. To fully realize her project, she requested a loan to purchase ornamental plants for resale. In the future, Carmela hopes to sustain her business and wants to see all of those in her family have a good standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase ornamental plants for resale

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Retailing helped Francisca to earn money for the family. She retails food snacks and vegetables and it brings a meager income of Php 6,000 per month, doing this type of work. She found her retailing business profitable since it's doing well for years now. Francisca plans to expand her retailing business. She applied a loan to PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to purchase inventories of vegetables for retail and raw ingredients for her snack vending. Francisca smiles at the fact it can provide for her family a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of vegetables for retail and raw ingredients for her snack vending

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya has a coconut farm in Rizal, Philippines, which is the primary source of income for her family. To generate additional earnings, she wants to plant bananas and grow root crops. Ligaya makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. 

She recently needed a loan to pay for clearing and plowing of land and holing and planting of seedlings, which she borrowed from Paglaum MPC.  Ligaya wishes to have more produce and be able to supply agri-products in the market.

loans.use: to pay labor for land preparation and seedlings

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 37 years old, married and has two children to provide for. She engages in a banana production to help her husband who is a driver, to earn more for a living. She aims for a greater income so that she can sustain the needs of her children. So she decided to take a loan to purchase fertilizer for the banana farm to result in a good harvest and have more banana's during harvest to sell in the market.

Mary Ann plan for the future to buy vehicle for the delivery of her banana's to the market.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her banana farm.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 59 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, home-care products and other groceries.

Esmeralda has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 36 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Esmeralda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, home-care products and other groceries

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mely is 62 years old and has one child who is in school.

Mely has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Mely has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 42 years old and has five children. Conchita is married and has four children who are in school.

Conchita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Conchita requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Conchita has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Conchita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 49 years old, married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jocelyn has a buying and selling peanuts in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of peanuts to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Alvaro Alberto

texts.es:
Álvaro es un hombre sonriente, alegre, emprendedor que trabaja diariamente en la cocina de su hogar, preparando la receta del éxito para su familia.
Se dedica a la venta de alimentos como empanas, pasteles, buñuelos y demás productos fritos.

Tiene una familia conformada por su pareja y dos hijos de 9 y 4 años de edad, hoy quiere solicitar un préstamo para de implementos y herramienta que harán aumentar su producción, aumentaran sus ventas y reducirán sus tiempos de producción.

El capital se invertirá en la compra de cilindro, insumos y utensilios de cocina (ollas y cucharones).

Álvaro busca en un futuro tener un restaurante y convertir este negocio en un legado familiar él cual se trasmita de generación en generación.
texts.en:
Álvaro is a man who is always happy and smiling. He is an entrepreneur who works daily in his home's kitchen preparing the recipe for success for his family. He makes a living in the sale of food like empanadas (traditional corn flour meat pie), pasteles (seasoned rice with other ingredients wrapped in a plantain leaf), buñuelos (cheese fritters) and other fried products.

He has a family that is made up of his partner and two children of 9 and 4 years of age. Now he wants to request a loan for implements and tools that will increase his production and sales, and that will reduce his production times.

The capital will be invested in the purchase of a gas cylinder, consumables, and kitchen utensils (pots/pans and ladles).

Álvaro hopes to have a restaurant in the future and convert this business into a family legacy which passes from generation to generation.

loans.use: to buy a gas cylinder, consumables, and kitchen utensils (pots/pans and ladles).

loans.name: Alonso Manuel

texts.es:
Para mantener sus cultivos el señor Alonso necesita abonos, riegos, y exterminadores de plagas, estos insumos son muy costosos, más para una persona humilde que debe asumir las perdidas por las inclemencias del clima, para una persona que es casada y tiene familia como Alonso por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de estos productos, este préstamo no lo hace por necesidad, lo realiza por crecimiento al tener este apoyo le permitirá proteger y abonar sus campos esperando una cosecha abundante que será bien vendida en el mercado generando mayor utilidad por ser precisamente abundante.

Él pensando de Alonso es que con el capital que se encuentra prestando no solo comprar esos insumos, desea invertir en la compra de semillas para aumentar su terreno, quiere convertirse en uno de los proveedores principales del mercado y juntar todo el dinero suficiente para vivir una vejez tranquila puesto que no abona capital para una jubilación y en los momentos difíciles lo que ahorre será de gran utilidad.

Apoya a Alonso y su deseo de expandir sus cultivos, un pequeño aporte ayudara a que siga habiendo abundancia de alimentos provenientes del campo.
texts.en:
To maintain his crops Alonso needs manure, irrigation and pest control. These inputs are very expensive, more so for a modest person who has to absorb the losses due to inclement weather, a person who is married and has family as Alonso has.

So he is requesting a loan to buy these products. He is not taking this loan out of necessity, he is doing it to grow. Having this support allows him to protect and fertilize his land hoping for an abundant harvest which will be sold on the market creating greater profit, precisely for being abundant. Alonso's thinking is the capital that he is borrowing is not only to buy inputs he wants to invest in seed to expand his land.

He wants to become one of the main producers in the market and gather the money needed to live a peaceful old age as he is not putting money into a pension plan and in difficult times what he saves will be of great use. Support Alonso and his wish to expand his crops. A little help will help him to have an abundance of food coming from his fields.

loans.use: to invest in buying seeds to increase his land as he wants to become of the main producers in the market.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 58 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, condiments, home-care products and other groceries.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fruit vending.

Evelyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, condiments, home-care products and other groceries

loans.name: Mirian De Jesus

texts.es:
Mirian, de 48 años de edad, está casada, se dedica al comercio, estudio hasta segundo grado, su esposo se dedica al trabajo agrícola y tiene un hijo que va a la escuela del cantón.

Mirian, tiene más de diez años de trabajar en el comercio de verduras, antojitos, pasteles, tostadas, etc. 

Ella, necesita el crédito para comprar material para hacer los alimentos para la venta como: papas, yuca, aceite, etc.

Mirian, sueña con construir en un futuro su casa de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Mirian is 48, married, makes her living in sales and has a second grade education. Her husband makes his living in agriculture and she has a son who goes to school in the district. 

Mirian has been working in the sale of vegetables, snacks, pastries, tostadas, etc. for ten years. She needs this loan to buy ingredients such as potatoes, yucca, oil, etc. to make food to sell. 

Mirian dreams of building her house out of bricks in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as potatoes, yucca, oil, etc. to make food to sell.

loans.name: Galy

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Galy works hard to support her family. She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising pigs and operating a general store.  

Galy has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell.

Galy hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Deicy De Jesus

texts.es:
Ella es Deicy es una mujer de 42 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos que se encuentra separada de su esposo, junto a ella se construye un local que se convertirá en un salón de belleza, ella tomo clases y se capacito en el tema y como ya es madre cabeza de familia decidió acelerar la construcción del negocio.

Para Deicy es bastante complicado mantener un hogar tan amplio, su ex-pareja le ayuda con la alimentación de los muchachos y nada más, de momento sus padres ayudan con el pago de los servicios públicos por eso pide con tanto esmero y necesidad un préstamo con el cual terminara de construir su negocio y comprar los elementos principales para iniciar su negocio de salón de belleza.

Deicy quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de un tejado, baldosa, un baño, una silla de motilar,  y lso elementos básico de peluquería, apoya dale la herramienta con la que quiere mantener su familia.
texts.en:
This is Deicy, a 42 year-old mother of four children who is separated from her husband. Together they built a place that will become a beauty parlor. She took classes and was trained in the subject and since she is now a mother and the head of her household, she decided to accelerate the construction of the business. 

It is quite difficult for Deicy to maintain such a large home. Her ex-partner helps her with food for the boys and nothing more and for now her parents help with paying the utilities. This is why, with great consideration and need, she is asking for a loan with which she will finish building her business and buy the main items to start her beauty salon. 

Deicy wants to apply for a loan for the purchase of a tile roof, a bathroom, a salon chair and basic hairdresser supplies; support  that will give her the tools to take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a tile roof, a bathroom, a salon chair and basic hairdresser supplies; support that will give her the tools to take care of her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for clutch and brake repairs

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 21-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He is an ambitious man who started to work in the construction field in 2013 with the aim to help his father, who is the main income provider in the family. His job consists of installing rocky stones. Despite his young age, during these years Hussein has been able to prove his competence by working efficiently.

Today, and to facilitate his work, he is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a wooden scaffold. As for his future plans, Hussein seeks to be the owner of a proper office where he will make agreements with qualified construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase a wooden scaffold

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for her family's house.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: From Larena in Siquijor, Angelita earns a living through selling clothes. She has enough inventory to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive against the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied for a loan to purchase stocks of Ready To Wear clothes to sell. Angelita hopes to finish the construction of her house to live comfortably with her children while they finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for Ready To Wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Owning a house and lot in the Philippines is not very easy. Even if it’s just a low-cost housing unit which is usually bare or “box-type,” its monthly amortization will still cut a large chunk from the worker’s regular salary. It is commonly payable in 25 to 30 years, meaning this amortization will always affect the family’s other needs such as food, utilities and education.

There were times that Mary Jane skipped paying their house amortization due to bloating family expenditures. This is why she is quite thankful for your previous support that went a long way and saved the whole family. She has been faithful in paying her previous loan. 

Lately, she again had trouble balancing their expenses vis-à-vis their income and she needed to prioritize the most important expenses like education and medical costs. As of now, the amortization needs to be paid soon before their housing unit gets forfeited. Mary Jane doesn’t want to find her family homeless thus she badly needs your support again. 

Mary Jane cannot easily produce that large amount of money, even though she receives a regular salary as a sewer in a garment factory in GMA, Cavite. Her husband Emmy has an irregular salary as a welder. Simultaneously, it’s enrollment season and they disbursed some amount for their child’s schooling. 

Mary Jane desires that their child becomes a successful professional and gains a more decent living wage someday. She also dreams of completing their house amortization so that they can legally call their house their own.

Luckily, Mary Jane is well guided as one of the beneficiaries of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative. This organization has arranged for an easy repayment scheme through salary deduction for their members and beneficiaries. Mary Jane continues to meet with her co-fellowship members in the Covenant Community Service Cooperative.

loans.use: to pay for her housing expense.

loans.name: Elaine

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Elaine is a resident of Santa Rosa, Laguna. She has been working as a Washing Quality Control Officer in a garment factory located in GMA, Cavite for eleven years now. Her job includes supervision of the washing process for garments and clothes, inspecting the quality of the washed products, as well as monitoring of some workers in the washing area.

Elaine is married to Romy, a tricycle driver, and they have four children. Elaine’s minimum wage combined with her husband’s irregular income as driver cannot usually suffice their growing financial needs. Their usual problem is how to make ends meet, because aside from basic needs such as food and utilities, they spend too much in transportation to and from their work area. Moreover, they are burdened with their children’s education. It’s not easy to raise four children and provide for their educational needs. When it’s time for enrollment, they look for reasonable loan and financial assistance but they are being lured by usurious lending agencies with very high interest rates. The couple, especially Elaine, is trying to avoid these loan sharks knowing that these usurious agencies will require her to surrender her ATM card as loan collateral. It is a blessing that she became a member of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative* where she found another option. It is her prayer that you can help her provide for her children’s tuition and avoid the lure of usurious money lenders. 

For Filipino families like Elaine’s, education is the most valued inheritance that they can give to their children. She trusts the Lord that their children will finish education through your kind help.

Elaine meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her life and work. *The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for employment. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services. **CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before they start their daily work routines. Bible readings, prayer devotions, and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is a hardworking and single woman entrepreneur.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Shiela dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, de 36 años de edad, es jornalero, estudio hasta noveno grado, no continuo sus estudios debido a la falta de recursos economicos en que sus padres vivian y decidio trabajar para ayudarles economicamente en los gastos de la casa, está acompañado y junto a su pareja tienen 3 hijos de 16, 14 y 12 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando en el centro educativo de la comunidad.

Juan, se dedica a trabajar por jornadas, tambien trabaja ordeñando vacas a los vecinos desde hace 4 años, trabajo que decidio realizarlo, por la misma falta de recursos economicos.

El preétamo que está solicitando es para pagar el alquiler de un terreno para sembrar maicillo y para comprar pasto para los animales, con esta ayuda podrá mejorar sus ingresos cuando obtenga la cosecha y cuando venda sus animale.

El sueño de Juan, es ayudarle a sus hijos economicamente para que puedan seguir estudiando y comprar un terreno propio, para no tener que alquilar cada vez que quiera realizar su siembra.
texts.en:
Juan is 36 years old, a day laborer and studied up to the ninth grade. He did not continue his studies due to his parents' lack of financial resources and he decided to work to help them with household expenses. He is in a relationship and he and his partner have 3 children ages 16, 14 and 12 who study at the community educational center.  Juan makes his living working day labor and also has milked the neighbors cows for 4 years. He decided to do this work due to the same lack of financial resources. 

The loan he is requesting is to pay rent on a piece of land to sow sorghum and to buy fodder for his animals. With this help he will be able to improve his earnings when he brings in his harvest and sells his animals. 

Juan's dream is to help his children financially so that they can keep studying and to buy his own piece of land so he won't have to rent every time he wants to plant his crop.

loans.use: to pay rent on a piece of land to sow sorghum and to buy fodder for his animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a new motor and a hopper to expand his services to meet the customer service demand.

loans.name: 13 Yên Hòa, Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mai is 23 years old and she is married with one child.
Mai has a service business taking photographs. She has been involved in this business for four years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. 
She is requesting a loan to purchase instruments to maintain the wedding preparation service shop.
In 2014, Mai joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Mai is the group leader of the 13 Yên Hòa, Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 
With her business profit, Mai hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase instruments to maintain the potography and wedding preparation service shop

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is 52 years old, married, and has three children who are still studying. Her husband is an employee in a local company. Due to the hard financial situation, she is requesting a loan from Vitas s.a.l., which she will use to pay her children's university fees. She is very eager to make use of the loan to insure a high educational level and path.

loans.use: to pay for her children's university fees

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 56 years old and married with 10 children.  With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda runs a buy-and-sell gasoline business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional containers of gasoline to sell.

She has been in this business for eight years.

In the future Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell fruits business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and farming sugarcane.  Alicia is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to  purchase additional basket of fruits to sell for her buy and sell fruits business.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional basket of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Emelieta

texts.en:
Emelieta is 55 years old and married with seven children.

Emelieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Emelieta has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Emelieta aspires to save enough money in order support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Romelie

texts.en:
Romelie works hard to support her family. Romelie is married and has a butcher shop business in the Philippines.

Romelie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase cattle and pigs to slaughter and sell.

Romelie has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Romelie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and pigs to slaughter and sell.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza es una mujer de 28 años de edad, es casada, aprendió de su marido el negocio de las flores y quiso tener su propio cultivo para que juntos generaran capital para tener una excelente calidad de vida y comprar una vivienda propia.

Inicio su trabajo en el año 2009 con un valor agregado de que entregaba los pedidos en la puerta de su casa sin ningún costo demás, esto le ha traído buenos clientes, pero los pedidos pequeños en ocasiones representan perdidas debido al desplazamiento que hay que realizar para entregarlas.

Pensando este problema Maritza busca un apoyo financiero con el cual completara el dinero para comprar una motocicleta, generara un empleo y tendrá un activo fijo que le permitirá entregar mayores pedidos diarios gracias  a la motocicleta, incrementando su utilidad y haciendo ver cada vez más en el mercado.
texts.en:
Maritza is 28 years old and married. She learned the flower business from her husband. She wanted to have her own crops so that they can generate capital together to have an excellent quality of life and to buy a home of their own. 

She began working in 2009 with a delivering orders with a mark-up from her home without any other cost. This brought good customers but occasional small orders resulted in losses due to displacement to be made to deliver them.

With this problem in mind, Maritza seeks financial support to buy a motorcycle that would generate employment. She will have an asset that will allow most of the daily orders delivered by motorcycle thereby increasing her usefulness and visibility in the market.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle that would generate employment. She will have an asset that will allow most of the daily orders delivered by motorcycle

loans.name: Lenly

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Lenly works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from farming sugarcane and running a general store. Lenly is borrowing 16,000 PHP through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF), to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport business. Lenly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Pathias

texts.en:
Pathias is aged 35 and happily married with one wife and four children aged 12, 10, 6 and 2. 

Pathias is borrowing a loan of is 3,000,000 UGX from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd (MDL).  He is an agriculturalist who does cattle trade and is also a principled farmer who does coffee farming and a banana plantation. He works for 8 hours a day and 6 days a week, and he also has a side income of trade in cows.  Pathias started the business in order to generate income for his family household.

The loan purpose is to buy cows for trade, fertilizers, chemicals and mulches for his plantations. Most of his clients are people in the rural community.
He started business in 1999. 

Pathias hopes to become the leading trader of cows in Kakanju, own large plantations of coffee and bananas, and produce more for sale in the area. He is always faced with the challenges of price fluctuations, banana bacterial wilt and high prices for agricultural inputs.  He is an honest and hard working person.

loans.use: to buy cows and organic fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products to resell for his business.

loans.name: Marziya

texts.en:
Marziya is a hospitable woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1975. She is living in the district with her family. She is married and has eight children. 

In order to feed her big family and ensure her children, she decided to do a business. She has experience from her childhood keeping livestock. She participated in a three-day training provided by IMON to start her new business. She understands that it is preferable to do business of keeping livestock. 

She got necessary information and knowledge about how to start a business of keeping livestock. She asked for a loan from Kiva and IMON to buy livestock. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a molding machine for manufacturing plastic accessories

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is encouraged that she accessed a 20,000 PHP loan which she used for spare parts and accessories and to do maintenance on her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan this time of 40,000 PHP to pay for the registration, gas and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and pay for her children's education.  She is thanking God and you in advance for your good heart and the financial help that will be given her.

Catherine prays for safe trips of her tricycle service. She also wants her children to get a College Education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the registration, gas and maintenance on her tricycle.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Bernadeth works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Bernadeth is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business for her food vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Bernadeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Felimon

texts.en:
Felimon is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a gasoline retailing business in the Philippines. 

He is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy additional containers of gasoline to sell for his gasoline retailing business.

Felimon has been in this business for 18 years. He also has a bakery business from which he earns additional income. 

Felimon has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. He dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Rajashree Group

texts.en:
Rajashree Group started in the year 2015 at BBC Pada in Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. There are 12 active independent women, with an objective to develop their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of the concerned group have their own profession and business. 

Soudamini is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and in the group members’ livelihood improvement. She is seated in the front row as the second person from the left-hand side with her hand raised in the photo. She is about 49 years old and living with her small family: her husband and two children.
 
Soudamini has been engaged in a clothing shop at the nearest market for the last 10 years. Her husband is also helping her to promote the business. Through her concerned business, she earns a monthly income of 9,000 INR. Her opinion is that, from this small income, it is very difficult to maintain her family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business, is practically impossible. So she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to avail a loan for the expansion of her business.

She planned to purchase different types of ready-made garments (especially for ladies and kids) at the wholesale rate. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for repairing and extending her house.
 
The other 11 members of the group are also smart at their profession and actively engaged in differ professions like hotel, vegetable vending, milk business, tailoring, rice business and grocery shop and hope to boost their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase different types of ready-made garments (especially for ladies and kids)

loans.name: Maa Majhi Gouri Group

texts.en:
Maa Majhi Gouri Group was formed in the year 2015 at J.K. Pur village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. There are six active, self-dependent women with an objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the members of this group have their own professions and businesses.

Gouri is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and their group members’ livelihood improvement. She is standing in the row as the middle person with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 49 years old and living with her small family, consisting of her husband and one child.

Gouri has been engaged in a vegetables business at J.K. Pur village for the last eight years. Her husband is helping her to promote the business. Through this business, she earns a monthly income of 6,500 INR. Her opinion is that the income is not sufficient to maintain her family, and hence there is almost zero surplus at the end of the month.

She planned to improve her business in the course of the loan, which resulted in taking the loan. She will purchase a huge quantity of vegetables and fruits such as potatoes, tomatoes, onions, garlic, ginger, brinjal, cauliflower, cucumbers, carrots, apples, bananas, etc. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for repair and extension of her house.

The other five members of her group are also smart at their professions and are also actively engaged with vegetable vending and grocery shops. With this loan, they hope to boost their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of vegetables and fruits such as potatoes, tomatoes, onions, garlic, ginger, brinjal, cauliflower, cucumbers, carrots, apples, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a mother of four children; she is 37 years old. As a mother she wants what is the best for her family. She wants to increase her income to sustain the needs of her children. So she decided to get a loan to buy fertilizer for her rice farm to produce a good harvest and generate more income.

Jocelyn's plan for the future is to save money from her business to sustain the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the rice farm.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business. Leonida successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Leonida's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and married with six children. Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Gloria has been in this business for 22 years. 

In the future, Gloria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Duhaga School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Winnie, she is the Deputy Head teacher of Duhaga Secondary School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Duhaga in Hoima, with 650 students.Duhaga School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.  The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.  Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced.  The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Duhaga School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term.  Winnie ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en: Ret is a 50-year-old mother of seven children, three of whom are in school, and they live in Battambang province. To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows rice, working on another farm for a fee and she also fishes. She has been involved in these businesses for more than five years and it earns her about 51,500 KHR per day. Due to a lack of funds to renovate her old house, she is now applying for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to pay for her house renovation fee. She hopes this loan will help her to improve her family’s standard of living and have a better house to live in.

loans.use: to pay for house renovation fees.

loans.name: Ashoki Group

texts.en:
Joseph, who is in his early 40s, is married and he has two children who are still at school.  He has been selling shoes since 2009.  He works from 6 a.m.to 8.30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Joseph's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase his shoe stock. He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully.  He is really happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva's support.  He used the profit to pay school fees, repay loans, build his own house and cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy up-to-date shoes styles and meet customers' requirements.  He dreams of buying consignment shoes.  

Joseph will share this loan with his loan group Ashok A which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to buy up-to-date shoe styles and meet customers' requirements.

loans.name: Merna

texts.en:
This is Merna from Caloocan City. Her partner, Jaime, is a fish vendor, and they have children.

Merna runs a “sari-sari” or variety store that provides general merchandise in the community. She also helps Jaime in fish selling, and at the same time she does direct selling of cosmetics, perfumes, apparel, bags and shoes. Her income from these ventures can help provide for their everyday needs and children’s education.

Knowing that the competition is stiff and profits are irregular, Merna dreams of expanding her business. She needs additional supplies in her variety store so as to meet the demands of customers who prefer to buy from a store with a wide selection. She also desires to have more customers in her direct selling business, and in due time, own a branch.

Merna knocks at your kind hearts for a loan assistance of PHP 20,000, which she can use to buy additional items for her variety store. She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items for her variety store

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 44 years old and is married with five children.

Geraldine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Geraldine has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Geraldine aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemi tiene 54 años y es madre de 4 hijos, Noemi se dedica a la producción de café que comercializa por medio de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio, en estos momentos Noemi quiere convertir sus fincas a producción orgánica y aprovechando que estas están muy afectadas por las plagas y la edad ah decidido replantar para iniciar el procesos desde cero. 
La producción orgánica es novedosa en el rubro del café ya que permite tener mercados seguros y mejores oportunidades para la comercialización en cuanto a precios. Noemi quiere replantar y convertir 1.5 hectáreas a producción orgánica, con las ganancias de su café Noemi espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y poder formar un patrimonio para sus cuatro hijos.
Noemi solicita un crédito para comprar todo lo necesario para la replantación y certificación orgánica tal como ser: Plantas de café, abonos orgánicos, insumos orgánicos y pago de mano de obra. 
Un crédito ayudaría a Noema a poder replantar y certificar orgánica su finca, con lo que tendrá la posibilidad de asegurar un buen mercado para su café.
texts.en:
Noemi is 54 years old and a mother of 4 children. Noemi makes living in coffee production marketed through COCAFCAL of which she is a partner at the moment. Naomi wants to convert her farms to organic production. Taking advantage of the fact that her farms are old and affected by pests, she decided to replant from scratch.

Organic production is new in the coffee business and it allows secure markets and better opportunities for marketing. Naomi wants to replant and convert 1.5 hectares to organic production. With the profits, Noemi hopes to improve the quality of life for her family and to form a heritage for her four children.

Noemi requests a loan to buy everything she needs for replanting and organic certification such as: coffee plants, organic fertilizers, organic inputs and labor payment.

Loan will help Noemi replant and have her farm certified organic. This will provide possibility to ensure a good market for her coffee.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants, organic fertilizers, organic inputs and labor payment necessary to convert her coffee farm into organic production.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Having been an accountant for 30 years, Ellen has decided to pursue her passion for selling home décor and gardening in her retirement. When she was in the work force, Ellen and her husband traveled to Hawaii often for his job in the military, and Ellen began raising orchids. She discovered that she was talented at raising orchids and many people were interested in purchasing her beautiful flowers. In fact, her husband built her a greenhouse and she had over 200 orchids at one point. When they moved, Ellen sadly had to give up this passion. 

In retirement, she has re-established her love for home decor and design, as well as gardening. Recently, Ellen bought 600 orchids, which she has been growing and raising, and she plans to sell these through her new online store. 

Last year, she participated in a six month training, where she learned via phone classes about online business. She learned about SEO and marketing, as well as methods for online sales, pricing, and general business information. Through this, Ellen has been able to more successfully start her online business and create an online presence through eBay and Facebook.

She established Cissy's Home Décor in July 2014 and began selling products online. Her store involves the online retail of large furniture, especially garden items such as planters for discounted rates as well as Ellen’s orchids. The business has been operating strictly through eBay for the past nine months, and is now expanding to a more established method of sales. 

She will use her Kiva loan to pay the fees associated with being an established seller on eBay. In addition, she will use part of her loan to purchase additional inventory.  The business is well positioned to grow with the addition of quality inventory, orchid sales, and a stronger online presence through the eBay store.

loans.use: to pay the fees associated with being an established seller on eBay and purchase inventory.

loans.name: Belina

texts.en:
Belina is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 27 years old. She is running a business sewing clothing in front of her house, and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as sewing machines, fabric, thread, sewing needles, and scissors. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Belina is living in a town nearby the school; and many people need her to sew school clothes, so she is located in a strategic place.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines, fabric, thread, sewing needles, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Pudak Sari Wangi Group

texts.en:
Ni Luh used her portion from the group's previous loan to purchase farming tools and fertilizer for her garden's cacao, clove, and coconut crops. 

6 months have passed since taking the loan, and Ni Luh can report that all of her crops produced a great result after having taken good care of them. Everyday she maintains the soil and treats it with an organic fertilizer combined with chemicals to make sure they grow free of insects or other diseases. The cacao produced more than before, and now cacao goes for a higher price: 30,000 IDR per kilo. She harvested 50 kilos in 2 weeks. Her harvest increased 50% compared to last season, and she’s very happy for this result. 

In general, the Pudak Sari Wangi Group earns a satisfactory profit. They are all very happy with their hard work finally paying off. And now they have decided to take a new loan, after having made a payment to MUK this past week.

This new loan will be used to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides, as well to replace the broken farming tools with the new ones. The group is grateful for the support they receive from Kiva's lenders, Kiva, and MUK. They promise to use the loan wisely. 

Ni Luh will use her loan portion to purchase fertilizer, insecticides, and a new farming tool. Now she is 50 years old and, together with her husband, she wants to spend her time and life working in the garden. She hopes in the next 6 months the results from her garden will be even better than before.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticides, and a new farming tool.

loans.name: Jose Fidel

texts.es:
José, de 45 años de edad, está acompañado, es agricultor,estudio hasta segundo grado, su pareja se dedica al trabajo agrícola y al comercio de verduras.

José, trabaja en la agricultura y la ganadería desde temprana edad.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para sembrar maíz, pipián. 

El sueño de José, es darle la oportunidad a sus hijos para que se preparen academicamente.
texts.en:
José is 45 years old and is in a common-law relationship. He is a farmer and studied until the second grade. His partner does agricultural work and sells vegetables.

José has worked in agriculture and ranching from a young age. 

José needs the loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides to plant corn. 

José's dream is to give his children the opportunity to prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides to plant corn.

loans.name: Ana Elida

texts.es:
Quien dijo que el campo no se divertían esas fueron las palabras de la señora Ana cuando decidida inicio a construir un negocio el cual es muy a una discoteca solo que alejada de la cabecera municipal y ubicada directamente en la vereda.

Ana es una mujer viuda que quedo como cabeza de familia de un hogar conformado por ella y 5 hijos, aprovecho un espacio y una chaza que tenía y la adecuo transformándola en discoteca ahora las personas vienen a quitarse estrés y divertirse en su negocio.

La empresa ha tenido muy buena aceptación, en su apertura se quedó sin licor para vender, ahora que se ha consolidado y es más reconocido Ana quiere tomar el riesgo de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de cervezas, licores, vasos, pasa bocas entre otros.

Este préstamo ayudara a esta humilde mujer a mejorar la capacidad del negocio, tener buen inventario y surtido suficiente para complacer las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
"Who said that you can't have a good time in the country?" These were Ana's words when she decided to begin to build a nightclub far from the municipal capital, which is located right by the road.

Ana is a widow, left as the head of the family in a home made up of herself and her 5 children. She took advantage of a space that she had and adapted it transforming it into a night club. Now people come to relieve themselves of stress and to have a good time in her business. 

The business has been well accepted. When the business opened she had no liquor to sell. Today it has consolidated and is more well known, and Ana wants to take the risk of requesting a loan to buy supplies of beer, liquor, glasses and appetizers, among other things.  

This loan will help this humble woman to improve the capacity of her business, have a good inventory and sufficient supplies to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies or beer, liquor, glasses and appetizers, among other things.

loans.name: Chivan

texts.en: Chivan is a 21-year-old single security guard at a financial institution in the city. He is from Takeo Province in Cambodia. Chivan has worked as a security guard since 2014, making an income of $5 per day. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in management at a university in the city. Chivan is requesting a loan because he needs finances to pay his second-year tuition fees. The loan will help him to get through the second year at university successfully. After graduation, he is going to find a better job with a reasonable salary; therefore, he will be able to build his own house.

loans.use: to pay his second-year tuition fees

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Working hard for your loved ones - it's priceless. Jeanne, 49, from Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines, is currently taking over a mineral water business. She also sells soft drinks in her neighborhood. Jeanne is married to Bobby, who works as a company driver. They support their household with their two incomes.

Jeanne dreams of having a better life for her children, who are the main reason why she wants to expand her inventory. However, she really needs your help. She envisions a developed business but is financially incapable. Jeanne is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more supplies of mineral water to sell. She knows that you'll help her cross this barrier. This is now your time to make an impact on a person's life. 

Jeanne meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies of mineral water to sell.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena, 35 years old, is married and has six children, all in school. She has an agricultural business, raising pigs, in the Philippines. Lorena has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lorena has been raising pigs for 2 years and has previously borrowed 3 times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Lorena would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia, 62 years old, is married and has five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 25 years, Ofelia has had a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall. In the future, Ofelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Nolen

texts.en: Nolen, 42 years old, is married and has two children. She has been raising pigs in the Philippines for four years and also earns additional income from food vending. Nolen is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins and to repair her pigpens. Nolen works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins and to repair her pigpens.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita, 50 years old, is married and has four children, two of them still in school. Anecita has an agricultural business, fattening pigs, in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Anecita has been in pig fattening for 5 years  and has previously borrowed 10 times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Anecita would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Godofredo Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Carlos pertenece al banco comunal NUEVO AMANECER DEL CUSCO, el socio continua dedicándose a trabajar en una entidad del estado en el área administrativa ,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante  a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de un electrodoméstico para su casa.
El socio agradece a los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Carlos belongs to the  "NUEVO AMANECER DEL CUSCO" communal bank. He continues to work in the administration area of a government entity. He is a responsible and diligent individual and this is the way he gets his family ahead. He is requesting a loan to buy an appliance for his house. He is grateful for the lenders who support him and promises to pay his installments on time and with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy an appliance for his house.

loans.name: Herchel

texts.en:
Herchel is 26 years old, married, and has one child to provide for. To earn a living and be able to help her husband who is a carpenter, in providing their family, she engages in a banana production. Herchel, as a mother, is always aiming for a greater income and good life for her family. 

She borrowed a loan at GDMPC to purchase fertilizer for the banana farm to produce good quality bananas and have a good harvest. She can deliver more stock in the market to generate more income. Herchel’s plan for the future is to buy a vehicle to use in delivering bananas in the market.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the banana farm.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 44 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Teresa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teresa has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Isabel has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for 11 years now. Isabel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a 51-year-old resident of Pasay, Philippines, and she is married to Ranio. She and her husband, manage their household while operating the business. They work hard for their children and to provide income for their everyday needs. 

Rosario maintains a charcoal business. She buys a huge quantity of charcoal and then repacks it to sell in a retail business. Usually, she sells each bag at PHP 5 to PHP 10 depending on the size. With this inventory, she is able to support the expenses of her household. To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of charcoal to sell.  

Rosario dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sreyya

texts.en:
Sreyya is a 42-year-old, married mother who lives with her two young children, her husband, and a mother in a village in the Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. To earn a living, she and her husband, who is 32 years old, have worked in a garment factory in the city since 2010, making a daily income of USD 14. She would like to improve the family’s finances; therefore, she needs to take out a loan to buy a cow for her mother to fatten and breed for calves to sell. 

This loan will help her have enough money to buy a cow to fatten and improve the family’s finances when the cow is able to produce calves. For her future plans, Sreyya is going to help her children earn high school diplomas and build fences around her house.

loans.use: to buy a cow to fatten and breed for calves to sell.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Doormats are very useful. So Eliza has chosen such to be the object of her business. By now, she has been engaged in selling such for more than three years. She is 55 years of age and a resident of Payatas,Quezon City, Philippines. Her husband, Pedro, is also a construction worker. Together, they work diligently to support and equip their household. 

Eliza earns well from the business. Usually, each doormat costs PHP 50.00 and above depending on its size. From this, she gains only an average profit. But it’s not stable since customers vary from time to time. 

Eliza is asking for a PHP 8,000 loan for her to buy additional stock and supplies of doormats for her business. This loan will be enough for her to improve her inventory also, at the same time, her sales. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stock and supplies of doormats for her business.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Mercedita has engaged in a foam business within her community for years now. She is 43 years of age and is married to Danny, who works as foam maker. They work hand-in-hand to provide for their needs. She offers her items at a low-cost which attracts people. 

Due to financial insufficiency, Mercedita wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional merchandise products and other materials that would help improve her business. 

Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Mercedita dreams for her business to grow bigger and have her own stall. She also hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise products and other materials that would help improve her business.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Conchita has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Conchita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing. 

Suzette is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Suzette has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 59 years old, and she is married with six children.

Leonila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional item like candies, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, etc. to sell.

Leonila has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Leonila aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like candies, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mabel Del Rosario

texts.es:
Mabel es una madre cabeza de familia, la cual tiene una adolescente que el ayuda a tender su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, para ella es una frustración que su hija deba estar en el negocio en vez de estar en una universidad preparándose para la vida, algo que la pone depresiva, por ello están tan comprometida en elevar sus ventas para sacar a su muchacha del negocio e inscribirla en algún cursos que sea de la pasión de su hija, pero para ello necesita capital, capital constante que le permita darle los pasajes y pagar la matricula cada semestre.

Mabel con su negocio apenas alcanza a pagar los gastos mínimos de su hogar, quiere vender mayor cantidad de productos y ampliar su surtido por ello necesita la ayuda de un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de surtido de la canasta familiar en general, abarrotes granos, productos de aseo persona, accesorios, productos de refrigeración, con la intención de hacer atractivo su negocio y que sus vecinos encuentren en la tienda todo lo necesario para su hogar, elevando su utilidad para cumplir su sueño tan preciado de costear la educación de su muchacha.
texts.en:
Mabel is the head of the household. She has a teenager who helps attend the store. It is a frustration for Mabel that her daughter has to work instead of being in a university preparing for life. It is depressing that she is committed to increase sales to get her daughter out from the work and register her into a courses that she is passionate about. She needs a constant capital to provide that path for her daughter and pay the tuition each semester.

Mabel’s business barely covers the minimum household expenses. She wants to sell more products and expand on variety. She needs the help of a loan to purchase assortment of staple goods, grocery grains, personal hygiene products, accessories, and refrigerated products. She intends to make her store attractive so that the neighbors find everything they need for their home. This will increase the utility of the store in order to fulfill her dream to afford the education for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy assortment of staple goods, grocery grains, personal hygiene products, accessories, and refrigerated products.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Thanks for your kindness and willingness to help lenders. Because of your previous support to Angela, she was able to improve sales from her small operating business - a sari-sari store. The income she got from this well aided the family needs then. 

To resume the enterprise, she humbly asks for financial assistance through a loan worth PHP 15,000. She would like to use this loan as additional capital for buying more quantity of merchandise products like grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. It's a great response for her if you'll be affirmative regarding the matter since this business is the only means of the family in getting a living. 

She hopes that you will not get tired of helping other people like her, because through this scheme of helping, many lives are being changed and transformed for the better. She prays that her business will eventually expand and that her family will deepen their faith in God more. As of now, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to be used as additional capital for buying more quantity of merchandise products like grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
At the age of 41, Emma is a mother of two children. As a mother she is always aiming for the best for her family. She wants to help her husband, who drives a motor cab driver for a living. That's why she does a vegetable garden to earn an income. 

Emma wants to increase her income to provide for her children's education, so she borrowed a loan to purchase fertilizer for her garden to produce a lot of vegetables. She will be able to deliver more vegetables in the market to generate more income.

Emma's plan for the future is to renovate her house out from her business income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the garden.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Zenaida is 37 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Zenaida has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Zenaida has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda owns a food stall in Pasay City, Philippines. She has been operating the business for almost two years now. She has four kids and is married to Roberto. Whatever income she gets basically from her chosen trade, she uses to help her husband in sustaining the family's expenses. 

Filipinos are fond of eating. And it is a big help to most when there are food stalls along the roads where they can eat at a hand without even going home to just merely cook. Perhaps this is the reason why Yolanda has chosen to manage a food stall. But Yolanda's food stall is different because it's a food stall on wheels. Mainly, she cooks street foods like fish balls, squid balls etc. A little help for the buyers because they won't need to walk a distant walk just to get food. With the business, she really earns well. 

However, Yolanda still wants to expand her business. She is asking a loan worth PHP 8,000. She will use this to buy more quantity of raw ingredients needed for her recipes. She wants to send to you her sincerest thanks for your goodness and generosity by now. 

In the future, she wants her family to experience progress and improve as well in her current business. She also prays for the good health of the household and the education of her children. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantity of raw ingredients needed for her recipes.

loans.name: Elithaflor

texts.en:
Elithaflor is a 35-year-old resident of Pasay, Philippines and she is married to Albert. She and her husband, who is also a vendor, manage their household while operating the business. They work hard for their children and to provide income for their everyday needs. 

Elithaflor maintains a charcoal business. She buys huge quantity of charcoal and then repacks them to sell in a retail business. Usually, she sells a each bag at PHP 5.00 to PHP 10.00, depending on the size. With this inventory, she is able to support the expenses of her household.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of charcoal for selling.  

Elithaflor dreams to expand her business more and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of charcoal for selling.

loans.name: Marigen

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marigen works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Marigen is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers for her buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business.

Marigen has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Pablita is 52 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Pablita has a selling herbal medicine business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more herbal products to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Pablita has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more herbal products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Evelie

texts.en:
Evelie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional box of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Evelie has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Evelie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ana is 57 years old and has one child in school.

Ana has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Ana requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy equipment needed for the maintenance of her business.

Ana has been in this business for four years. In the future she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy equipment needed for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is a 42 years old, married, and has three children. As the head of the family, he wants the best for his family. With the help of his wife, he does a vegetable garden as a source of living for his family. He wants to improve his family's living; he aims to get a better income. 

So he decided to borrowed a loan to purchase more vegetable seedlings for the garden so that his vegetable garden will expand and having more vegetables to grow will generate greater income.

In the future, Elmer wants to save money out from his business income.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable seedlings for the garden.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Flora requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like rice, noodles, vegetables, meat, etc. for her food production business.

Flora has been in this business for two years now.

Flora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like rice, noodles, vegetables, meat, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Charina

texts.en:
Charina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 35 years old and has four children who are in school.

Charina has a furniture making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy wood and other supplies to use in her business.

Charina has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy wood and other supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Help Leticia see a glimpse of a better future through your generosity today. With a dream of having her own boutique in the tailoring industry and earning money to ensure that her kids will complete schooling, she works very hard to help her husband sustain the family.

This is Leticia and she is currently involved in the tailoring business. She was recently able to faithfully repay the loan she got worth PHP 27,000. This couldn't be possible without your help lenders. Thank you so much! Through you, she was able to buy enough raw materials needed in her business like fabric, thread, needles and other related items, thus paving a way to a better remedy for their family's daily expenses.

This time, she wants to improve the other one. She would like to ask again for a loan, worth PHP 30,000. This would be a big help for her family. She would use this certain amount to improve her inventory by acquiring an additional sewing machine and buying more materials needed to make clothes. She knows that with this purpose, clothes production would be easier.
