She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to improve her inventory by acquiring an additional sewing machine and buying more materials needed to make clothes.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Eleonor is 41 years old and has three children who are in school.

Eleonor has a furniture making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy bamboo and other materials needed for her business.

Eleonor has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bamboo and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ruth requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gear for her business.

Ruth has been in this business for 50 years now.

Ruth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for her business.

loans.name: Marida

texts.en: Marida is a 20-year-old, single office cleaner. She is working for a financial institution in the province. She resides in the Svay Rieng Province in Cambodia. She has been working as an office cleaner since 2014, earning around $4.60 per day. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in accounting at the university in the province. Due to the fact that she is short of the finances to pay her tuition fees for the first year, she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to cover her university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree. For her dream, Marida wants to run her own business, and she also wants to build a bigger house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees for the first year

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 60 years old and widowed with six children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Patricia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Patricia has been in this business for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 55 years old and now has two children who are in school.

Benedicta has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Benedicta has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Benedicta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 40 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Milagros runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like shampoo, fabric conditioner, coffee, cereals, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Milagros has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, fabric conditioner, coffee, cereals, canned goods, etc.

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, fabric conditioner, coffee, cereals, canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Luchando Por Un Sueño Group

texts.es: El grupo “LUCHANDO POR UN SUEÑO” es un grupo conformado por socias dedicadas al comercio minorista. Cinthia tiene 29 años de edad es conviviente con tres dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de CD en un pequeño puesto ubicado en un mercado. De esta manera puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de alimentación y educación de sus hijos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra  de más CD y  accesorios para  celulares  de su nuevo negocio que logro implementar hace poco. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Cinthia  es la cuarta del lado izquierdo viste polo negro.
texts.en:
The group “LUCHANDO POR UN SUEÑO” is a group made up of members dedicated to commercial retail. 

Cinthia is 29 years old, she is in a common-law relationship and has three dependants. She works selling CDs in a small stand in the market. In this way she is able to support her husband with the expenses of providing food and education for their children. 

The loan will be invested in buying more CDs and cell phone accessories for her new business which she had the success of beginning a little while ago. 

The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan that they have provided. In the photo Cinthia is the fourth from the left side in a black shirt.

loans.use: to buy more cell phones and cell phone  accessories.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie, single, earns a living through her direct-selling business of cosmetics, food supplements and clothing. This is how she helped support her parents. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. 

Recently, Melanie applied for a loan to purchase additional wood and marine plywood for the repair of their house. She hopes to live comfortably and wishes nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood and marine plywood for the repair of her parent's house.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 24 years old and has two children who are in school.

Sheryl has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

Sheryl has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase supplies and soaps to resell

loans.name: Shibani

texts.en:
Shibani is a 26-year-old woman from Alipurduar. She lives with her husband, Sajal, and their only son, who is a preschooler. Shibani attended school up to twelfth grade, but due to her parental monetary problems, she could not continue her education.

Shibani's husband works in a local jewelry shop. He is unable to provide sufficient income to the family. Therefore, Shibani faces difficulties to make ends meet.

Shibani is not such a lady to sit idle in this situation. She wants to provide all sorts of facilities to her only son in terms of food, education, and health. They possess a plot of farmland adjacent to their house. She has decided to cultivate jute on the farmland, as it is a profitable crop. So, she thinks this will be a lucrative business because jute fibers are commonly used in making ropes, bags, sacks, canvas, gunny bags, twine, carpets, curtains, etc.

Shibani has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase jute seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies to cultivate jute. She is very hopeful to earn profit from this cultivation, which will help her to reach her goals.

Shibani is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies to cultivate jute.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is married and lives in Poblacion, Oroquieta City.  She earns a living through agriculture, focusing on farming and she has coconut palms. She also operates a small sari-sari (general) store. As the responsible mother of her children and loving grandmother to her grand children, she believes education is the key to success in life. 

Olivia hopes to provide for her family's needs. With the loan of 20,000 PHP she will be able to support and pay for the tuition fees of her granddaughter. She wants nothing more than to see all of those in the family be happy and live a comfortable life..

loans.use: to support and pay for the tuition fees of her granddaughter

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.en:
Clothing is indeed an unchangeable part of our lives. Due to this mere fact, Isidoro, 45, found business himself in clothing industry. He is a very hard working entrepreneur from Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. Marialyn, his wife, helps him to provide for their family needs. As of now, she operates a buy-and-sell business of ready-to-wear products. Through this, he is able to gain a little profit which he basically uses for primary expenditures within the household. 

Here, he buys general merchandise from wholesalers and then sell them in retail to mostly people within their community. Products can range from ready-to-wear clothing and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to favorable prices and the many options they are offering. 

With a humble heart, Isidro would like to avail a 25,000 PHP loan to purchase more products and merchandise to sell. He will use his loan to improve his sales and his additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family.

In the future, he hopes to have more branches for his business. He also desires for his children to be able to complete their studies and have their stable works. He meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more products and merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Edilenda

texts.en:
Edilena is 48 years old; she is married and living in Owawon, Sindangan, in the Philippines. Edilena and her husband earn a living through farming, supporting her children's education and their family needs. She joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in March of 2013. She is a hardworking mother who has a strong determination to pursue her goals for the benefit of her family, alleviating poverty. 

Edilena wants to provide her family with comfortable living quarters, for which she requested a loan to purchase marine plywood, wood, and nipa thatch for her house. Someday, she hopes to buy land to expand her farming activities and venture into agribusiness to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase marine plywood, wood, and nipa thatch for her house

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 64 years old, a widowed woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Violeta has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell.

Violeta has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Mercy works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Mercy is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Komba a la main levée au bout sur la photo.
Komba est une malienne de 58 ans marié mère de 3 enfants âgés de 30 à 15 ans. Les enfants ne vont pas à l’école. Son mari est un agriculteur. Depuis 10 ans Komba cultive son propre champ d’arachide et fait l’élevage .Elle fait recourt au RMCR pour pouvoir acheter de la semence améliorée et des intrants agricoles pour accroitre sa productivité et plus de moutons pour l’élevage .Le souhait de Komba est de pouvoir par son activité se prendre en charge et préparer le mariage de ses 3 garçons qui ne sont d’abord marié. Le bénéfice tiré de la vente de l’arachide après l’hivernage et de l’élevage lui permet de prendre en charge ses dépenses et d’épargner pour le mariage de ses enfants.
texts.en: Komba is the one at the end in the photo with a hand raised. She is a 58-year-old Malian woman and a married mother of three children, aged 15 to 30. The children are not in school. Her husband is a farmer. For ten years, Komba has been cultivating her own field of peanuts and raising livestock. She turned to the microfinance institution RMCR to purchase improved seeds and farm inputs for increasing her productivity and the number of sheep to raise. Her wish is to be able to support herself through her business and to plan for the weddings of her three sons who are not married. The profit made from selling peanuts after the rainy season and from raising livestock enables her to cover her expenses and to save money for her children’s wedding.

loans.use: to purchase improved seeds for cultivating her fields

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 47 years old, a married woman with one child, who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jane has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jane requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Jane has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Jane would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Soudié est la dame au bout qui a levé sa main droite.
Soudié  est  une femme  veuve  qui a perdu son mari il y’a sept ans de cela, elle est Malienne  âgée de 40 ans ,mère de cinq  enfants  dont une fille  et deux sont à l’école elle est de teint claire   et quitta à l’école en classe de quatrième année fondamental elle pratique l’agriculture  elle achète les semences d’arachide  dans les différents marchés  de la localité et après les récoltes  elle revend les graines d’arachide dans les même localité pour agrandir son champs  d’arachide elle fait recourt  au RMCR ,elle pratique cette activité il y’a dix ans et les profits qu’elle tire de cette activité lui permet de subvenir les besoins de la famille  et payer les frais scolaire de ses élèves qui sont à l’école.
texts.en: Soudié is the lady at the end in the photo with her right hand raised. She is a widow who lost her husband seven years ago. She is a 40-year-old Malian and the mother of five children, including a girl, and two are in school. She has a light complexion and dropped out of school in the 4th grade. She is a farmer and purchases peanut seeds at the different markets in her town. After the harvest, she sells the peanuts in the same town. In order to expand her peanut field, she turned to the microfinance institution RMCR. She has been doing this work for ten years, and the profits she makes from it enable her to meet family needs and to pay the school fees for the students in school.

loans.use: to purchase peanut seeds for her field

loans.name: Arminda

texts.en:
A $800.00 loan is offered to Arminda to improve her business.  Arminda opened her stall in 2011 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like  Fanta, noodles,sugar, salt, fish, oils, biscuits. Arminda is generating a good income from selling.
She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Arminda is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy Fanta, noodles, sugar, salt, fish, oils, biscuits for her stall

loans.name: Saksida Group

texts.fr:
Mme MADELEINE est responsable du groupe  SAKSIDA. Mariée elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé à 31 ans et le moins âgé a 20 ans. 01 enfant va à l’école et elle à 06 personnes en charge.
Madame fait la restauration depuis 06 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans  les marchés environnant.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter 10 sacs de pommes de terre et veut réaménager son restaurant.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité. Elle ambitionne se construire une autre maison.
texts.en: Ms. MADELEINE is the official of the group SAKSIDA and a married mother of two children. The older is 31, and the younger is 20. One is in school. She has six persons to support. Ms. MADELEINE has been in the restaurant business for six years. She gets her supplies from nearby market. With the money granted, she wants to purchase 10 sacks of potatoes, and she wants to renovate her restaurant. She wants to use the profits from the loan to expand her business. Her ambition is to build another house.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of potatoes and renovate her restaurant

loans.name: Benedite Group

texts.fr:
Mme HAOUA est responsable du groupe  BENEDITE. Mariée elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé à 33 ans et le moins âgé a 26 ans. 01 enfant va à l’école et elle à 07 personnes en charge.
Madame vend des prêts à porter depuis 19 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans  le  marché de son quartier.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter 30 complets d’habits prêts à porter.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité. Elle ambitionne payer une parcelle.
texts.en: Ms. HAOUA is the official of the group BENEDITE and a married mother of three children. The oldest is 33, and the youngest is 26. One is in school. She has seven persons to support. Ms. HAOUA has been selling ready-to-wear clothing for nineteen year. She gets her supplies from the market in her district. With the money granted, she wants to purchase 30 ready-to-wear outfits. She wants to use the profits from the loan to expand her business. Her ambition is to buy a parcel of land.

loans.use: to purchase 30 ready-to-wear outfits

loans.name: Andreina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Andreina es una mujer del campo, luchadora y trabajadora, una persona que entrega cuerpo y alma en sus actividades y que lo da todo por la familia, ella se dedica a la cría de cerdos el cual s un negocio que junto a la agricultura que practica su esposo generan los ingresos necesarios para tener una buena calidad de vida.

Andreina tiene dos hijos no de 4 y otra de 3, con su esposo acordó de que quieren un mejor futuro para ellos y alejarlos del campo, llevarlos a la ciudad que estudien y sean unos profesionales no quieren que tenga una vida de un campesino que no es mala pero buscan que sean ellos los primeros en su familia que se gradúan de una educación universitaria.

Por este pensamiento y la decisión que tomo con su esposa ella quiere solicitar un préstamo para aumentar la producción en sus cocheras esto le significara trabajar por muchas más horas pero el futuro de sus hijos valen todos los esfuerzos.

Con el capital quiere comprar una cerda de cría, 4 lechones y construir una cochera nueva.
texts.en:
Andreina is a hard-working, driven country woman. She gives herself body and soul to her activities, and gives her all to her family. She raises pigs. This business, along with her husband’s farming, generates the necessary income to have a good quality of life.

Andreina has two children: one is 4 and the other 3. She and her husband agreed that they want a better future for them, taking them out of the countryside, and to to the city to study to become professionals. They don’t want them to have a country lifestyle, which isn’t bad, but they hope for them to be the first in their family to graduate with a university education.

With these thoughts and the decision she made with her spouse, she wants to request a loan to increase production in the pig sheds. This means many more hours of work, but her children’s future makes the efforts worthwhile.

With the money she wants to buy a breeding sow, 4 piglets and to build a new shed.

loans.use: to buy a breeding sow, 4 piglets and to build a new shed.

loans.name: Khursanoy

texts.ru: Ее зовут Хурсаной. Она живет в районе Вахш, и ей 24 года. Хурсаной приятная в общение девушка. Она живет вместе мужем, свекровью и сестренкой. Свекровью 51 лет. Мужу 26 лет. Сестренке 20 лет. Хурсаной занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Она продвигает эту деятельность более 5 лет. Хурсаной обратилась за кредитом для приобретения новой швейной машинки. Из-за того что ее нынешняя машинка не выполняет свои функции как прежде хорошо она решила купить новую, чтобы продолжить работу и сохранить источник дохода. Запрашиваемый кредит очень важно для Хурсаной. Поддержите ее!
texts.en: Her name is Khursanoy. She lives in the Vakhsh region and she is 24 years old. Khursanoy is a pleasant young woman to talk to. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and sister-in-law. Her mother-in-law is 51 years old, her husband is 26, and her sister-in-law is 20. Khursanoy takes orders for sewing women's clothing. She has been pursuing this activity for more than five years. Khursanoy applied for a loan to purchase a new sewing machine. Due to the fact that her machine is not performing its functions well, she decided to purchase a new one in order to continue her work and to keep an income source. The loan requested is very important for Khursanoy.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Nana est celle qui a mis sa main sur le sac de riz.
Nana est  une femme Malienne restauratrice  celle qui a les mains sur le sac du riz, âgé de quarante deux ans,  mariée, mère de quatre enfants dont deux filles et un est scolarisé. Elle-même n’a jamais été à l’école. Son mari est un agriculteur. Elle réside avec son mari dans la même localité. Elle  fait la restauration pendant les jours de la foire locale elle achète le sac du riz  et pendant la saison des pluies elle fait un champ d’arachide de deux hectares avec une semence de 100kg vu la progression de ses activités elle fait recourt au service RMCR  elle s’approvisionne en semence et riz dans les différentes foires locales et les bénéfices qu’elle gagne  de ces activités lui permet d’aider son mari à couvrir les charges de la famille. Elle pratique cette activité il y’a douze ans de cela.
texts.en:
Nana is the one with her hand on the sack of rice. She is a Malian restauranteur, 42 years old, and the married mother of four children, including two girls. One is in school. Nana herself has never been to school. Her husband is a farmer. She resides with her husband in the same town. She operates a restaurant business. When the local fair is active, she purchases a sack of rice. She works a 2-hectare peanuts field with 100 kg of seeds. 

Given the progress of her work, she turned to RMCR services. She gets her supplies of seeds and rice at the different local fairs. The profits she earns from her work enable her to help out her husband in covering family expenses. She has been in business for twelve years.

loans.use: to purchase rice for her restaurant and some seeds for her field

loans.name: Sinsin Ton Group

texts.fr:
Mariam est celle qui a  la daba en main sur la photo au bout.
Mariam est une agricultrice malienne âgée de 38 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants dont 1 fréquente école. Son époux est un cultivateur et fait le jardinage pendant la saison sèche, ils sont tous analphabètes. Mariam a commencé l’agriculture à l’âge de 25 ans elle fait son propre champ d’arachide dont la surface est de 1 hectare chaque année. Vu les dépenses que Mariam effectue tel que semences (arachides), engrais, labour pour avoir un champ d’arachide. Mariam a beaucoup pensé à l’avenir de ses enfants elle fait recourt au RMCR pour avoir un financement de son champ d’arachide. Après la récolte, le profil tiré dans le champ d’arachide lui permet à prendre certaines charges familiales, frais de scolarité, santé et habillement.
Mariam a effectué ses achats dans le marché local de la zone, et après la récolte la vente aussi passe dans le même marché
texts.en:
Mariam is the one at the end in the photo and holding a daba [short-handled hoe]. She is a Malian farmer, 38 years old, and a married mother of three children, including one in school. Her husband is a farmer and a market gardener during the dry season. They are both illiterate. Mariam began farming at the age of 25. Each year, she works her own peanuts field, which is 1 hectare in size. 

Given the expenses Mariam has, such as peanut seeds, fertilizer, and the cost of plowing, she has thought a lot about her children’s future. She has turned to the microfinance institution RMCR to obtain financiing for her field. After the harvest, the profit derived from it enables her to cover certain family expenses, schooling costs, healthcare, and clothing. 

Mariam makes her purchases at the local market. Following the harvest, her sales are made at the same market.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for her peanuts field

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr: Kadidia est une  femme Malienne celle qui détient le bélier en mains, elle est âgée de quarante deux ans, marié, mère de quatre enfants dont deux filles et trois sont scolarisés elle réside avec son mari dans la même localité. il est cultivateur. Elle pratique l’élevage et l’agriculture elle fait cette activité il y’a six ans de cela  pour  acheter plus de moutons  et agrandir la superficie de son champs d’arachide Elle fait recourt au service RMCR   et elle s’approvisionne en moutons et les semences d’arachide dans les différentes foires de la localité et après les récoltes  elle revend les graines  et les animaux  dans les mêmes marchés les profits qu’elle tire de ces activités lui permet d’aider son mari à couvrir les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Kadidia is a Malian woman. She is the one in the photo holding the ram. She is 42 years old and a married mother of four children, including two girls. Three are in school. She lives with her husband in the same town. He is a farmer. Kadidia raises livestock and is a farmer. She has been doing this work for six years. 

To purchase more sheep and to expand her peanuts field, she turned to RMCR services. She gets her supplies of sheep and peanut seeds from the different fairs in her town. After the harvests, she sells the peanuts and the animals at the same markets. The profits she derives from her work enable her to help out her husband in covering family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for her field and some sheep to sell

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Дехканка из района Вахш, это Мавлуда. Мавлуда уроженка района Вахш. Она с детства следит за работы отца. Сейчас Мавлуда продвигает деятельность отца. Она занимается растениеводством уже 10 лет. Можно сказать, что Мавлуда опытная, умная, ответственная и профессионал по этой сфере работы. Она не боится трудиться. У нее имеется не большой земельный участок. Она на половине поле посадила помидоры, болгарские и кукурузу. И половину полю она готовить к новому посеву урожай. Мавлуда каждый сезон после сева урожай обрабатывает землю и урожай минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить качественный и здоровый урожай. В этом году она не смогла копить денег для минеральных удобрений и семян урожай, потому что у нее было много расходов на жизнь. И решила взять кредит для купли необходимые средства.  Мавлуда верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: This collective farmer from the Vakhsh region is Mavluda. Mavluda is a native of the Vakhsh region. Since children, she has been watching her father work. Now, Mavluda is pursuing her father's trade. She has been raising crops for ten years. One could say that Mavluda is experienced, clever, responsible and professional in this sphere of work. She is not afraid to work. She has a small plot of land. On one half, she planted tomatoes, bulgar and corn. And on the other half, she is preparing to plant a new crop. Every season, Mavluda after planting the crops prepares the land and uses mineral fertilizers, in order to get a quality and healthy crop. This year, she was not able to save money for mineral fertilizers and seeds, because she had many life expenses, and she decided to take a loan to purchase the needed resources.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and crop seeds.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.ru: Гулшану 59 лет. Она из Чиликул. Гулшан живет вместе сыном и невесткой.  Сыну 30 лет. Невестке 26 лет. Сын находится на заработках загранице, по причине что он не нашел себе подходящую  работу в стране. У Гулшан высшая образования. Она  работает учительнице в школе уже 38 лет. Гулшан умная, серьезная и заботливая женщина. Она любить детей.  Гулшан обратилась за кредитом, потому что хочет закончить ремонт. На фотке снята Гулшан, и ее не законченный дом. Гулшан хочет нанять мастера и закончить ремонт. Она просит кредит для купли стройматериалы и для оплаты услуги мастера. Но у нее нет такая сумма денег. По этой причине Гулшан обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Gulshan is 59 years old. She is from Chilikul. Gulshan lives with her son and daughter-in-law. Her son is 30 years old. Her daughter-in-law is 26. Her son is working abroad, because he could not find a suitable job in country. Gulshan has a higher education. She has been working as a schoolteacher for 38 years. Gulshan is a clever, serious and loving woman. She loves children.

Gulshan applied for a loan because she wants to finish repairs. In the photograph is Gulshan and her unfinished home. Gulshan wants to hire a master repairman and to finish repairs. She is requesting a loan to purchase building materials and to pay for the services of a master repairman. But she does not have this sum of money. For this reason, Gulshan applied for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for finishing repairs and for paying for the services of a master repairman.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Amor is 39 years old and has three children who are in school.

Amor has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. Amor requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dry goods like shorts, pants, t-shirts, shoes, etc. to sell.

Amor has been in this business for two years. In the future Amor would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dry goods like shorts, pants, t-shirts, shoes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Espoir

texts.fr: Très dynamique et actif, Espoir est un homme marié. Agée de 47 ans, Espoir habite à Baguida avec sa femme et ses cinq enfants. Espoir est un commerçant de charbons de bois dans son quartier pour trouver son revenu. Espoir s’approvisionne quatre fois au marché. Espoir désire accroitre son commerce et sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbons de bois afin de réaliser un bon revenu pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation.
texts.en: Very energetic and active, Espoir is a married man, 47 years old, and living in Baguida with his wife and his five children. Espoir is a charcoal merchant in his district to earn his income. He gets his supplies four times [per month] at the market. His wish is to grow his commerce and is requesting this loan to put in an order for some sacks of charcoal in order to realize a good income, so as to help his children with their education.

loans.use: to purchase 7 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo est une femme mariée qui vit avec ses trois enfants à Adidogomé. Adjo est âgée de 36 ans et vend de la bouillie préparée à base du maïs et de la farine de manioc dans son quartier et des beignets pour l’accompagner. Adjo s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché pour disposer son stock. Pour commander des bols de farine de manioc et un sac de maïs, Adjo demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et gagner plus de bénéfice pour venir en aide aux diverses charges de sa famille.
texts.en: Adjo is a married woman who lives with her three children in Adidogomé. She is 36 years old and sells porridge made from cornmeal and cassava flour, served with beignets, in her district. She gets her supplies once a month at the market in order to have an inventory. To put in an order for tubs of cassava flour and a sack of corn, Adjo is asking for this loan to realize her purchase and to earn more profit, so as to help out her husband in covering the various family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of corn and 32 tubs of cassava flour

loans.name: Gurbanmurat

texts.ru: Это мужчина Гурбанмурат. Ему 54 лет. Он проживает вместе с семьей в районе Чиликул. У него не большая семья, состоящая из его любимой женой, сынам, невесткой и внуками. Невестка домохозяйка, она следит за порядком дома и за детьми. Сам Гурбанмурат занимается выращиванием крупнорогатого скота, и овцы. Ему в работе помогает его сын. Он хочет расширить животноводческую деятельность, путем увеличения поголовья скота. Кроме, овцы у него остался один крупнорогатый скот. Для совершения данной операции ему необходимо определенная сумма денег. Так как у него не хватает денег, Гурбанмурат обратился за кредитом. Доход от животноводческой деятельности обеспечить его семью. Гурбанмурат собирается сохранить бизнес и не хочет потерять источник дохода.
texts.en: This man is Gurbanmurat. He is 54 years old. He resides with his family in the Chilikul region. He has a small family, consisting of his beloved wife, son, daughter-in-law, and grandsons. His daughter-in-law is a homemaker; she keeps order in the home and watches the children. Gurbanmurat himself raises cattle and sheep. His son helps him in his work. He wants to expand his livestock activities by increasing his livestock count. In addition to the sheep, he had one steer. To complete this operation, he needs a certain sum of money. Since does not have sufficient money, Gurbanmurat applied for a loan. Income from raising livestock supports his family. Gurbanmurat intends to save the business and does not want to lose the income source.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and keep the business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gloria is 52 years old now.

Gloria has a food vending business in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Gloria has been in this business for 11 years. In the future Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 44 years old and married with six children. With five children in school, Adelaida works very hard to provide for them.

Adelaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Adelaida has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Adelaida would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Damaris Antonia

texts.es:
Damaris es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Sahagún desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de comidas por encargo como lo son los tamales, chorizos, empanadas, arepas, entre otros.

Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Damaris y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.

Damaris desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de algunos utensilios de cocina y compra de insumos para continuar realizando sus recetas como pollos, harina, queso, entre otros.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia, oportunidad que le brinda la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Darmaris is a humble and hardworking woman who has dedicated a great part of her life to caring for her children.  She lives in the town of Sahagún where she prepares and sells food such as tamales, chorizo, empanadas, arapes, and other things.

She sells these foods mainly to neighbors in the area who know Dearmas and know that they will always get good food at good prices.

Darmaris wants to increase her sales and work in a more comfortable manner, so she is asking for a loan to buy some utensils and supplies so she can continue making her dishes such as chicken, flour, cheese, and other things.

This loan will allow her to get her business ahead to she can obtain the necessary income to continue supporting her family, thanks to the opportunity provided by Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy utensils and supplies.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: Josephine est une femme mariée qui vit Baguida avec sept enfants à sa charge. Josephine travaille  activement pour l’épanouissement de ses enfants. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Josephine vend des produits d’alimentations générale à la devanture de sa maison afin d’avoir son bénéfice. Josephine achète ses provisions quatre fois par mois sur un marché local du quartier et demande ce crédit pour commander un panier de tomates fraiches et des sacs d’épices. Josephine souhaite plus de bénéfice pour favoriser l’épanouissement de ses enfants.
texts.en: Josephine is a married woman who lives with her seven children in Baguida. She works actively for her children to thrive. To achieve her goals, Josephine sells grocery items in front of her house to make a profit. She purchases her supplies four times a month at the local market in the district and is asking for this loan to put in an order for a basket of fresh tomatoes and bags of spices. Josephine’s wish is make a higher profit for the sake of her children’s development.

loans.use: to purchase a basket of tomatoes and 2 bags of spices

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: A 52 ans, Ayaba est une femme mariée et avec ses quatre enfants elle vit dans le quartier de Baguida. Restauratrice, Ayaba est une revendeuse de pate bandée et des poissons frits et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Ayaba réalise une très bonne rentabilité avec son activité génératrice de revenu. Ayaba nécessite ce crédit pour acheter un sac de maïs et un tas de poissons frits afin de gagner plus de bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Ayaba, aged 52, is a married woman and lives with her four children in the Baguida district. A restaurateur, she sells “pate bandée” and fried fish. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market. Ayaba makes a good profit from her revenue-generating business. She has need of this loan to purchase a sack of corn and an order of fried fish, so as to earn more profit and to help her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of corn and an order of fried fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in chickens and rabbits, and increase his sales and production.

loans.name: Mahmadjon

texts.ru:
Его зовут Махмадчон. Ему 29 лет. Он проживает в районе под названием Руми. Он женат и отец одного ребенка. Махмадчон начинающий бизнесмен. Он хочет заниматься продажей продукт питания. Он арендует магазин, где  собирается, занимается продажей продуктов питания. Он перевез продукты питания, но для оплаты арендного места нет денег, и он хочет взять кредит и оплачивать арендного места. 
В дальнейшем он планирует приобрести свою торговую точку и расширить бизнес. Махмадчон сейчас верит и надеется на поддержку с Вашей стороны.
texts.en:
His name is Mahmadjon. He is 29 years old. He resides in a region called Rumi. He is married and the father of one infant. Mahmadjon is starting businessman. He wants to sell groceries. He rents a store where he intends to sell groceries. He transported groceries, but does not have money to pay the rent, and he wants to take a loan and to pay the rent.

In the future, he plans to purchase his own trade booth and to expand business. Mahmadjon now believes in and hopes for support.

loans.use: to increase inventory (groceries).

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi est un homme marié âgé de 32 ans. Kossi  vit à Baguida avec sa femme et leurs deux enfants. Pour assurer les charges de la famille, Kossi  est menuisier qui fabrique des chaises pour vendre. Cette activité lui permet de gagner le bénéfice qui pourrait l’aider à répondre aux besoins de la famille. Kossi  achète les bois trois fois par mois. Kossi  souhaite acheter des troncs de bois et sollicite ce prêt pour réaliser ses attentes et promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants grâce au profit tiré.
texts.en: Kossi is a married man, 32 years old, who lives in Baguida with his wife and their two children. To ensure family expenses are covered, he works as a furniture maker and makes chairs to sell. This business enables him to earn a profit, which could help him respond to family needs. Kossi buys wood three times a month. His wish is to purchase three logs and is asking for this loan to realize his expectations and to advance his children’s education through the profits generated.

loans.use: to purchase five logs to make furniture

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 24 ans qui vit dans le quartier de Baguida pour entreprendre son activité. Mère d’un seul enfant, Afi vend des produits des feuilles de tisane dans le quartier pour subvenir aux divers besoins. Afi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Afi demande ce crédit pour commander des bols de feuilles afin de bien vendre et avoir plus de bénéfice. Afi désire réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à son enfant.
texts.en: Afi is a married woman, 24 years old, who lives in the Baguida district to carry out her work. A mother of one child, she sells products for herbal infusions in her district to cover her various needs. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market. Afi is asking for this loan to put in an order for tubs of leaves in order to do well in her sales and to have more profit. Her wish is to realize profits for supporting her husband covering family expenses also for allowing her child a good education.

loans.use: to purchase 5 tubs of herbs

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es: Otilia en su fábrica ofrece una variada gama de bolsos y carteras para dama en diferentes tonalidades, estilos  y materiales. Su cónyuge recibió capacitación por parte de unos maestros artesanos en la ciudad de Cúcuta en el departamento de Norte de Santander y a su vez la incorporó en su aprendizaje para que a futuro esta carismática mujer en compañía de su cónyuge iniciaran su propia microempresa.  Su negocio está ubicado en el municipio de Tubará en el departamento del Atlántico y sus principales clientes son almacenes ubicados en las ciudades de Barranquilla, Cartagena y Santa Marta.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer Credikiva, por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  para invertir en materias primas; cuero, material sintetico y accesorios, también la nómina de sus trabajadores. Con esta inversión pretende aumentar la producción para responder a la demanda de sus clientes y obtener mejores resultados.  Ella es madre de una hija y su meta familiar es adquirir un vehículo, en su negocio espera ampliar la producción y mantener la calidad de sus productos a buenos precios.
texts.en:
Otilia has a factory where she makes a wide range of ladies handbags and purses in different colors, styles, and materials.  Her husband received training  from one of the master craftsmen in the city of Cucuta  in the department of Northern Santander.  In turn, he involved his wife in his training so that in the future this charismatic woman, along with her husband, would start her own small company.  

Her company is located in the municipality of Tubara in the department of Atlantico, and her main customers are stores located in the cities of Barranquilla, Cartagena and Santa Marta. At this time, she is applying for her first Kiva loan, through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use this loan to invest in raw materials, including leather, synthetic materials, and accessories, and she will also use the funds to pay her workers.  With this investment, she plans to increase her production so that she can respond to the demand of her customers and obtain better results. Otilia is the  mother of a daughter, and her goal for her family is to buy a vehicle. In her business, she hopes to expand production and maintain the quality of her products at good prices.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials and to pay her employees

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo vit à Baguida et est âgée de 32 ans. Mariée, Adjo est mère de six enfants et travaille activement pour favoriser leur éducation. Adjo vend des poissons fumés dans son quartier pour avoir son revenu de subsistance. Adjo s’approvisionne dix fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des paniers de poissons, Adjo demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité nécessaire pour l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en: Adjo lives in Baguida and is 32 years old. She is a married mother of six children and works actively for the sake of their education. She sells smoked fish in her district to make an income. She gets her supplies ten times a month at the market. To put in an order for baskets of fish, Adjo is asking for this loan to realize her purchase and to make the profit necessary for her family to thrive.

loans.use: to purchase 2 baskets of fish

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es: Maria tiene 48 años de edad tiene un hijo de 8 años es divorciada vive en Guaranda Provincia de Bolivar, ella trabaja como Empleada Domestica, solicita el crédito para el pago de unas deudas pequeñas que tiene y gastos personales como ropita para su hijo, ya que es padre y madre por que no tiene otro ingreso solo lo de su trabajo, su sueño es tener una casa propia, sus desafios son las enfermedades, en su tiempo libre le gusta salir al parque con su hijo.
texts.en: Maria is 48 years old and she has an 8 year-old son.  She is divorced, and she lives in Guaranda in Bolivar province. She works as a domestic. Maria is requesting a loan to pay off some small debts that she has, and to pay for some personal expenses such as clothing for her young son.  She serves as both father and mother, as she has no source of income other than from her work. Maria's dream is to have her own house.  Her challenge is to deal with illnesses.  In her free time, she likes to go to the park with her son.

loans.use: to pay off some debts and to pay for some personal expenses

loans.name: Monlouchi

texts.fr: Monlouchi est une femme divorcée qui vit Baguida avec quatre enfants à sa charge. Monlouchi travaille  activement pour l’épanouissement de ses enfants. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Monlouchi vend des produits d’alimentations générale à la devanture de sa maison afin d’avoir son bénéfice. Monlouchi achète ses provisions trois fois par mois sur un marché local du quartier et demande ce crédit pour commander des bonbons et des pierres d’argiles. Monlouchi souhaite plus de bénéfice pour favoriser l’épanouissement de ses enfants.
texts.en: Monlouchi is a divorced woman who lives in Baguida with her four children in her care. She works actively for her children to thrive. To achieve her goals. Monlouchi sells grocery items in front of her house to make a profit. She purchases her supplies three times a month at a local market in the district and is asking for this loan to put in an order for candies and clay stones [a household cleaning product]. Monlouchi’s wish is make a higher profit for the sake of her children’s development.

loans.use: to purchase 12 packets of candies and a bag of clay stones

loans.name: Se Be Alla Ye Group

texts.fr:
Sali est celle qui tient la corde du bélier sur la photo.  Elle fait l’embouche ovine. Agée de 47 ans, mariée et mère de 11 enfants âgés de 10 à 31 ans. Trois fréquentent l’ecole parmi ses enfants.
Depuis plus de 6 ans elle exerce son activité d’embouche. Sali achète ses moutons au marché de sa localité, les engraisse puis les revend au même marché.
Sur la photo les autres membres exercent le même métier d’emboucheur. Pour bien pratiquer son activité d’embouche ovine elle fait recourt aux services du RMCR. Elle prend de l’argent pour acheter plus de moutons destinés à l’embouche.
Afin d’élargir son activité d’embouche ovine Sali  utilise bien le prét, son rêve est de conquérir les grands marchés de bétail de la localité. Ce prêt contribuera à l’autosuffisance alimentaire et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Sali is the one holding the ram’s rope in the photo. She is a livestock farmer of sheep. She is 47 years old and the married mother of eleven children, aged 10 to 31 years old. Three of them attend school. For over six years, Sali has been fattening livestock. She purchases her sheep at the market in her town, fattens them, and then resell them at the same market. 

In the photo, the other members work in the same trade fattening livestock. To do well at this work involving sheep, Sali turned to RMCR services. She is using the money to purchase more sheep to be fattened. To expand this business of hers, Sali is using the loan well. Her dream is to conquer the big livestock markets in town. This loan will help her be self-sufficient in food and cover her children’s schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to sell later

loans.name: Nandita

texts.en:
Nandita is a 31-year-old woman who lives with her husband and one daughter in Sigijani, a small village in Falakata, West Bengal. She attended school up to grade 9 and then dropped out due to the poor economic resources of her parents. She is now a housewife, and after managing her household chores, she helps her husband in his agricultural activities. 

Nandita's husband got involved in the traditional family business of agriculture years ago to earn a living. He cultivates paddies on his farmland. Being the staple food in the region, paddy (rice) has very good demand in the markets. 

As it is the only source of income, they want to make sure that the production is abundant. She needs to earn and save much more in order to fulfill her dream of giving a proper education to her daughter. She needs to buy more fertilizers and seeds so that she can grow good quality paddy, which will provide her with a good income. 

For this she needs more funds, so she seeks a loan from Kiva via BJS. The loan will uplift her economic conditions, build her confidence and will ensure a bright future for her daughter.

Nandita is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The borrower is 30 years old. Originally from the Southern Andes of Peru, he moved to the capital at 16, where he started working in the production of wool clothing with his brother. Ten years later, he was able to expand his business, working for a company that exports wool clothes, working alongside his wife and his brother. 

Last year, he was diagnosed with TB and began a difficult treatment. During that time, he was unable to work, but, as soon as he recovered, he returned to his business. He would now like to increase production through the purchase of a new sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Sibani

texts.en:
Sibani is a 21-year-old married lady. She is a mother of two young children (one son and one daughter). She lives with her husband and children in the village of Alipurduar of West Bengal, India. Sibani studied up to grade 8. She wants to provide good education to her children so that they can lead a decent life. Besides doing household jobs, Sibani works as a domestic cook in her village.

Sibani's husband, Mohan, is an auto rickshaw driver. He offers transportation service in the village and nearby village using his three-wheeled auto rickshaw in order to make a living. He carries people from one place to another. Now the auto has been damaged in an accident and needs maintenance. He wants to repair it as soon as possible as it is the main income-generating source for their family.

As a responsible wife, Sibani decided to help her husband and applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to cover the cost of repairing the auto rickshaw. Sibani hopes that with the help of this loan, her husband can repair the auto rickshaw and can provide better transport facilities to the village people, and thus, can earn a lucrative income. In the future, she wants to purchase one more auto.

Sibani and her husband are very happy after getting the loan and are thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the repair cost of her husband’s auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fish to process into smoked fish and salted fish

loans.name: Krishna

texts.en:
Krishna is a married woman from Falakata. She is 35 years old and an active and energetic entrepreneur. Krishna lives with her husband and her two daughters. Her daughters read in the local village school. Krishna is a woman of strong determination and perseverance, through which she has achieved success in her small dairy business. 

Krishna's husband, 45-year-old Gautam, is engaged with a small business. He has a very inconsistent income, so the family survives on Krishna's small-scale business of rearing cows and selling their milk. Their monthly income is hardly sufficient for their household expenses, their daughters’ education expenses and her business expenses. 
 
So seeking to improve their financial and living situation, Krishna wants to increase the earning potential of her milk selling business. Thus she seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to buy a new cow, which will allow her to sell more milk. The loan will help her take the necessary step towards ensuring that she can provide well enough for their daughters' education. 

Krishna is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and expand her dairy business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To prepare a room for rent

loans.name: Shweta

texts.en:
Shweta is 34 years old and an enterprising woman. She lives in Alipurduar district in West Bengal. Her husband, Amitabh, deals in a medicine business. She is a mother of one school-going daughter. 

Shweta supports her family financially by running a clothing business. She purchases varieties of clothing according to the seasonal demand from a wholesaler and sells them at the retail price in her neighborhood. She mainly sells frocks, shirts, salwar suits, saris, etc. Her customers are gradually increasing day by day. The continuous price rise of the essential commodities and the concern of saving for the future have made Shweta think to expand the size of her small-scale business. 

To this end, she intends to obtain a micro-loan from BJS, Kiva's partner, that will allow her to stock additional quantities of garments so she will be able to expand her customer base. The profit generated from her business will help her improve her standard of living and remain financially secure in uncertain times. 

Shweta owes a debt of gratitude to her lenders and humbly thanks them for supporting her.

loans.use: to purchase varieties of clothing for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Lenie Pugales

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ma. Lenie Pugales works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming seaweed. Ma. Lenie Pugales is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 65 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Delia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Delia has been in this business for 28 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned good, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Delia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Terencia

texts.en:
Terencia is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Terencia is 45 years old now.

Terencia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Terencia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Terencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Chhapira

texts.en:
Chhapira is a married woman from Falakata in West Bengal. Fifty-year-old Chhapira, a mother of three children, is engaged in a dairy business. Her only daughter is married, and two sons are engaged in the poultry business.

Chhapira's husband is a cultivator by profession. For additional income, Chhapira has been engaged in a cow milk selling business for the many years. From this activity, she is able to contribute a small share to her family's household expenditures. She sells cow milk and cattle byproducts to her customers. Now she wants to invest in her business for enhancing their business activity. She wants to purchase another milking cow to cater milk to more customers for increasing her income, so she is seeking a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner.

Chhapira believes that good production of milk will take care of her financial expenses for the rest of the year. She plans to use the savings for purchasing a plot of agricultural land.

Chhapira is very happy and thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 49 years old and married with 11 children.  With three of her children in school, Estela works very hard to provide for them.

Estela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Estela has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Estela would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat is a 32-year-old married factory worker with two children, and she lives in the Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. She has worked in a factory since 2013 and earns approximately $5 per day. Her husband is 33 years old, and he is a driver, transporting garment-factory workers for monthly fees, earning $5 per day. Her two children are in school. 

Phat’s wooden house is old, and she would like to build a new house, so she requested a loan to buy construction materials to build a new house. With this loan, she will be able to have enough construction materials to build a proper house and live in better conditions. In the future, she wants to buy more soil to fill the yard around her house and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a new house

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming seaweeds. Teresita is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 45 years old and has eight children. She is married and has five children who are in school.

Teresa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresa requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Teresa has been in this business for one year now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Bahorali

texts.en: Bahorali is a brave guy. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1994. He is living in a small town with his family. He is single. He is a student at university. He studies law, business and policy. He likes his specialty and wants to be a good specialist. He helps his parents and works to earn money to make a living. After classes and weekends, he works at a brick production factory. He appealed to IMON, asking for a loan to pay his higher education costs. He awaits Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay his higher education costs

loans.name: Jenena

texts.en:
Jenena is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jenena is 37 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jenena has a general store business in the Philippines. Jenena requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and other personal care products.

She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Jenena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and other personal care products.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is a 50-year-old married woman. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Felipa requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Felipa has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Felipa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Josue Noe

texts.es: Con 35 años de edad Josué muestra ser un hombre trabajador que  presta sus servicios en una empresa pública cercana a su localidad, actividad que le permite aportar a la economía de su hogar. Josué vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y su hija de 10 años de edad a la que apoya para que estudie, ya que sabe que es la mejor manera de garantizarle un futuro mejor. Josué desea cambiar el techo del corredor de su vivienda, ya que esta se encuentra deteriorada, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: madera, clavos, lámina y alambre para cambiar el techo del corredor y de esta manera brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
At age 35, Josue is a hard-working man who is employed at a public company near his town.  His job allows him to contribute to the household economy.  Josue lives in his own house with his wife and 10-year-old daughter who he encourages to study because he knows it is the best way to guarantee a better future.

Josue wants to change the roof of his porch which is damaged, so he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy wood, nails, metal sheeting and wire.  By changing the roof he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy wood, nails, metal sheeting and wire to change the roof of his porch to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, de 41 años de edad, está soltero, se dedica a la agricultura, estudio hasta quinto grado, sus hijos están estudiando y él los apoya cada semana, ya que no está con la mamá de sus hijos

Juan, es agricultor, trabaja como jornalero y trabaja en sus propios cultivos tambien, porque desde pequeño le gusta la agricultura.

Juan, necesita el crédito para comprar abono, pesticidas y herbicidas.

El sueño de Juan, es que sus hijos sigan estudiando, para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Juan, 41, is single, works in agriculture and studied through fifth grade.  His children attend school and he provides them with weekly support since he does not live with their mother.

He works as a day laborer on other farms and also grows his own crops because he has enjoyed agriculture since he was little.

Juan is in need of a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides.  His dream is to see his children continue their education and become professionals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides.
